These are general tests with no theme-specific angle
These tests describe general tests to run against DB objects
Tests that are *not* general standards. You are welcome to disagree with them.
Tests that are specific to the Millenium Gen2 project
Standards for correctly implementing Redwood patterns
These tests identify functionality that appears unintentional and could cause problems.

These are best practices that apply to Universal Theme applications.

test.test_name: Page JS should avoid intervals and timeouts
test.query_clob:
with aap as (select case
                    when ((lower(trim(JAVASCRIPT_CODE)) like '%setinterval%'
                             or lower(trim(JAVASCRIPT_CODE)) like '%settimeout%'
                             or lower(trim(JAVASCRIPT_CODE_ONLOAD)) like '%setinterval%'
                             or lower(trim(JAVASCRIPT_CODE_ONLOAD)) like '%settimeout%')) 
                    then 'N' 
                    else 'Y'
                    end pass_yn,
                    application_id,
                    page_id,
                    build_option,
                    page_mode,
                    created_by,
                    created_on,
                    last_updated_by,
                    last_updated_on,
                    page_name,
						        workspace
            from apex_application_pages a

)
select aap.pass_yn,                          
       aap.application_id, 
       aap.page_id,
       aap.created_by,
       aap.created_on,
       aap.last_updated_by,
       aap.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) has inaccessible JS', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) has inaccessible JS', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) issue_title,
       aap.page_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aap.page_name,
       aap.page_mode,
			 aap.workspace
from aap
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aap.application_id
where aap.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
Avoid setting intervals and timeouts with Javascript as it can impact the accessibility of your page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.2.2(A) : Pause, Stop, Hide:  
    For moving, blinking, scrolling, or auto-updating information, all of the following are true:
    
    Moving, blinking, scrolling  
    For any moving, blinking or scrolling information that (1) starts automatically, (2) lasts more than five seconds, and (3) is presented in parallel with other content, there is a mechanism for the user to pause, stop, or hide it unless the movement, blinking, or scrolling is part of an activity where it is essential; and
    
    Auto-updating  
    For any auto-updating information that (1) starts automatically and (2) is presented in parallel with other content, there is a mechanism for the user to pause, stop, or hide it or to control the frequency of the update unless the auto-updating is part of an activity where it is essential.
    
2.  2.3.1(A) : Three Flashes or Below Threshold:  
    Web pages do not contain anything that flashes more than three times in any one second period, or the flash is below the general flash and red flash thr~
test.fix: Remove the offending javascript.

test.test_name: List entries should avoid hardcoding tab indexes
test.query_clob:
with aale as (
    select case
         when (lower(trim(entry_attribute_08)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(entry_image_alt_attribute)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(translate_attributes)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(entry_attribute_05)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(entry_attribute_10)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(entry_attribute_09)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(entry_attribute_06)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(entry_attribute_07)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(entry_attribute_03)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(entry_attribute_02)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(entry_image_attributes)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(entry_attribute_01)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(entry_attribute_04)) like '%tabindex%') then 'N' 
         else 'Y'
       end pass_yn,
       application_id,
       entry_image_attributes,
       entry_image_alt_attribute,
       entry_attribute_01,
       entry_attribute_02,
       entry_attribute_03,
       entry_attribute_04,
       entry_attribute_05,
       entry_attribute_06,
       entry_attribute_07,
       entry_attribute_08,
       entry_attribute_09,
       entry_attribute_10,
       translate_attributes,
       last_updated_by,
       last_updated_on,
       build_option,
       entry_text,
       list_entry_parent_id,
       list_entry_id,
	     workspace
    from apex_application_list_entries)
select aale.pass_yn,                          
       aale.application_id, 
       null page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aale.last_updated_by,
       aale.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('List Entry `%0` (app %1) has a hard coded tab index', 
        p0 => aale.entry_text, 
        p1 => aale.application_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('List Entry `%0` (app %1) has a hard coded tab index', 
        p0 => aale.entry_text, 
        p1 => aale.application_id) issue_title,
       aale.list_entry_id component_id,
       aale.list_entry_parent_id parent_component_id,
       aale.entry_text,
			 aale.entry_image_attributes,
       aale.entry_image_alt_attribute,
       aale.entry_attribute_01,
       aale.entry_attribute_02,
       aale.entry_attribute_03,
       aale.entry_attribute_04,
       aale.entry_attribute_05,
       aale.entry_attribute_06,
       aale.entry_attribute_07,
       aale.entry_attribute_08,
       aale.entry_attribute_09,
       aale.entry_attribute_10,
       aale.translate_attributes,
			 aale.workspace
from aale
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aale.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aale.application_id
where aale.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
It is inadvisable to alter the default tabindex of elements on a page because it can cause the experience between the sighted and unsighted users to diverge.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.4.3(A) : Focus Order : If a Web page can be navigated sequentially and the navigation sequences affect meaning or operation, focusable components receive focus in an order that preserves meaning and operability.
test.fix: Remove the hard-coded tabindex.

test.test_name: IR reports should avoid hard coded indexes
test.query_clob:
with aapi as (
        select case
               when (lower(trim(detail_link_attributes)) like '%tabindex%'
                       or lower(trim(icon_view_img_attr_text)) like '%tabindex%' ) 
               then 'N' 
               else 'Y'
               end pass_yn,
               page_id,
               application_id,
               detail_link_attributes,
               icon_view_img_attr_text,
               created_by,
               created_on,
               updated_by,
               updated_on,
               region_name,
               region_id,
	             workspace
         from apex_application_page_ir
    )
select aapi.pass_yn,                          
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       aapi.created_by,
       aapi.created_on,
       aapi.updated_by last_updated_by,
       aapi.updated_on last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Report `%0` (app %1, page %2) has a hardcoded index', 
        p0 => aapi.region_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Report `%0` (app %1, page %2) has a hardcoded index', 
        p0 => aapi.region_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) issue_title,
       aapi.region_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapi.region_name,
       aapi.detail_link_attributes,
       aapi.icon_view_img_attr_text,
			 aapi.workspace
from aapi
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
where aapi.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
It is inadvisable to alter the default tabindex of elements on a page because it can cause the experience between the sighted and unsighted users to diverge.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.4.3(A) : Focus Order : If a Web page can be navigated sequentially and the navigation sequences affect meaning or operation, focusable components receive focus in an order that preserves meaning and operability.
test.fix: Remove the hard-coded tabindex.

test.test_name: Combo of button labels + region names should be unique / page
test.query_clob:
with aapb as (select application_id, 
                     page_id, 
                     label, 
                     workspace,
                     last_updated_by,
                     last_updated_on,
                     build_option,
                     button_name,
                     button_id,
                     button_attributes,
                     region,
                     dense_rank() over (partition by application_id, page_id, region, label order by button_id) therank
                from apex_application_page_buttons
                where label not in ('Reset', 'Cancel', 'Save', 'Delete'))
select case when aapb.therank = 1
            then 'Y'
            else 'N'
            end pass_yn,
       aapb.workspace,
       aapb.application_id, 
       aapb.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapb.last_updated_by,
       aapb.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Button `%0`/`%3` (app %1, page %2, region `%5`) is not unique [attributes : `%4`]', 
        p0 => aapb.button_name, 
        p1 => aapb.application_id,
        p2 => aapb.page_id,
        p3 => aapb.label,
        p4 => aapb.button_attributes,
        p5 => aapb.region) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Button `%0` in region `%3` (app %1, page %2) is not unique', 
        p0 => aapb.label, 
        p1 => aapb.application_id,
        p2 => aapb.page_id,
        p3 => aapb.region) issue_title,
       aapb.button_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapb.button_name,
       aapb.label,
       aapb.button_attributes,
       aapb.region
from aapb
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapb.page_id
                                      and aap.application_id = aapb.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on  aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on  aabo2.build_option_name = aapb.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapb.application_id
where aapb.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and aapb.therank = 2
test.explanation:
Screen-readers announce buttons in the context of their parent region. Consequently, the combination of button labels and region names must be unique per page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.5.3(A) : Label in Name: For user interface components with labels that include text or images of text, the name contains the text that is presented visually.
2.  3.3.2(A) : Labels or Instructions:  
    Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input.
3.  4.1.2(A) : Name, Role, Value : For all user interface components (including but not limited to: form elements, links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be programmatically determined; states, properties, and values that can be set by the user can be programmatically set; and notification of changes to these items is available to user agents, including assistive technologies.
4.  2.4.6(AA) : Headings and labels describe topic or purpose.
test.fix: Make the button label or the parent region name more descriptive to make the combo unique / page

test.test_name: IR columns are not null
test.query_clob:
with aapi as (select case
                     when (trim(report_label) is null
                    or lower(trim(report_label)) = ' '
                    or trim(form_label) is null
                    or lower(trim(form_label)) = ' ') then 'N' 
                     else 'Y'
                   end pass_yn,
                   application_id,
                   page_id,
                   region_id,
                   region_name,
                   report_label,
                   form_label,
                   display_order,
                   created_by,
                   created_on,
                   updated_by,
                   updated_on,
                   build_option,
                   display_text_as,
                   column_alias,
                   column_id,
							     workspace
            from apex_application_page_ir_col a)
select aapi.pass_yn,                          
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       aapi.created_by,
       aapi.created_on,
       aapi.updated_by last_updated_by,
       aapi.updated_on last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) is missing a label. Labels are required for accessibility.', 
        p0 => aapi.column_alias, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) is missing a label.', 
        p0 => aapi.column_alias, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) issue_title,
       aapi.column_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapi.column_alias,
       aapi.report_label,
       aapi.display_text_as,
			 aapi.workspace
from aapi
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapi.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapi.application_id
where aapi.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
This plausibly affects sighted users as much as screen-reader users. Columns should be descriptive for clarity.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.5.3(A) : Label in Name: For user interface components with labels that include text or images of text, the name contains the text that is presented visually.
2.  3.3.2(A) : Labels or Instructions:  
    Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input.
3.  4.1.2(A) : Name, Role, Value : For all user interface components (including but not limited to: form elements, links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be programmatically determined; states, properties, and values that can be set by the user can be programmatically set; and notification of changes to these items is available to user agents, including assistive technologies.
4.  2.4.6(AA) : Headings and labels describe topic or purpose.
test.fix: Provide descriptive column names

test.test_name: Static Content HTML is well formed
test.query_clob:
select svt_stds_parser.valid_html_yn(aapr.region_source) pass_yn,                         
       aapr.application_id, 
       aapr.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapr.last_updated_by,
       aapr.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Region `%0` (app %1, page %2) has malformed HTML : `%3`', 
        p0 => aapr.region_name, 
        p1 => aapr.application_id,
        p2 => aapr.page_id,
        p3 => substr(aapr.region_source,1,50)) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Region `%0` (app %1, page %2) has malformed HTML', 
        p0 => aapr.region_name, 
        p1 => aapr.application_id,
        p2 => aapr.page_id) issue_title,
       aapr.region_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapr.region_name,
       aapr.template,
       aapr.display_position,
       aapr.source_type,
       aapr.component_template_options,
       aapr.report_template,
       aapr.region_source,
			 aapr.workspace
from apex_application_page_regions aapr
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapr.page_id and aap.application_id = aapr.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapr.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapr.application_id
where aapr.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and aapr.source_type = 'HTML/Text'
and aapr.region_source is not null
test.explanation:
HTML that doesn't close tags appropriately is often forgiven by browsers but screen readers can have more trouble. HTML must be checked strictly for appropriately opened and closed tags.

Checking for matching HTML tags. This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  4.1.1(A) : Parsing : In content implemented using markup languages, elements have complete start and end tags, elements are nested according to their specifications, elements do not contain duplicate attributes, and any IDs are unique, except where the specifications allow these features.
test.fix:
This test will raise errors for void elements without closing slashes (eg `
` and `` will pass but `
` `` will not ) . Technically, the closing slash is _optional_ on void elements but it may be simpler to just add the slash?

test.test_name: Classic Columns have wellformed HTML
test.query_clob:
select case when svt_stds_parser.valid_html_yn(aaprc.heading) = 'N'
            then 'N'
            when svt_stds_parser.valid_html_yn(aaprc.column_link_text) = 'N'
            then 'N'
            when aaprc.html_expression is not null 
            then svt_stds_parser.valid_html_yn(aaprc.html_expression)
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,                          
       aaprc.application_id, 
       aaprc.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aaprc.last_updated_by,
       aaprc.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Classic Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has malformed HTML [html exporession :`%3`, heading:`%4`, column_link_text: `%5`', 
        p0 => aaprc.heading, 
        p1 => aaprc.application_id,
        p2 => aaprc.page_id,
        p3 => aaprc.html_expression,
        p4 => aaprc.heading,
        p5 => aaprc.column_link_text) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Classic Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has malformed HTML', 
        p0 => aaprc.heading, 
        p1 => aaprc.application_id,
        p2 => aaprc.page_id) issue_title,
       aaprc.region_report_column_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aaprc.heading,
       aaprc.column_is_hidden,
       aaprc.column_alias,
       aaprc.html_expression,
       aaprc.workspace,
       aaprc.column_link_text
from apex_application_page_rpt_cols aaprc
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aaprc.page_id and aap.application_id = aaprc.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aaprc.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aaprc.application_id
where aaprc.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
HTML that doesn't close tags appropriately is often forgiven by browsers but screen readers can have more trouble. HTML must be checked strictly for appropriately opening and closing tags.

Checking for matching HTML pairs. This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  4.1.1(A) : Parsing : In content implemented using markup languages, elements have complete start and end tags, elements are nested according to their specifications, elements do not contain duplicate attributes, and any IDs are unique, except where the specifications allow these features.
test.fix: Fix the HTML - make sure all open tags are closed

test.test_name: DA should avoid "get focus" events
test.query_clob:
with aapd as (
        select case
                 when when_event_name in ('Get Focus') then 'N' 
                 else 'Y'
               end pass_yn,
               page_id,
               dynamic_action_name,
               last_updated_by,
               last_updated_on,
               build_option,
               application_id,
               dynamic_action_id,
               when_event_name,
	             workspace
         from apex_application_page_da
    )
select aapd.pass_yn,                          
       aapd.application_id, 
       aapd.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapd.last_updated_by,
       aapd.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Dynamic Action `%0` (app %1, page %2) uses inaccessible event : `%3`', 
        p0 => aapd.dynamic_action_name, 
        p1 => aapd.application_id,
        p2 => aapd.page_id,
        p3 => aapd.when_event_name) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Dynamic Action `%0` (app %1, page %2) uses "get focus" event', 
        p0 => aapd.dynamic_action_name, 
        p1 => aapd.application_id,
        p2 => aapd.page_id) issue_title,
       aapd.dynamic_action_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapd.dynamic_action_name,
       aapd.when_event_name,
			 aapd.workspace
from aapd
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapd.page_id and aap.application_id = aapd.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapd.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapd.application_id
where aapd.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
Avoid setting focus with Javascript as it can impact the accessibility of your page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  3.2.1(A) : On Focus : When any user interface component receives focus, it does not initiate a change of context.
test.fix: Remove the offending javascript.

test.test_name: IG Columns should avoid hard coded tab indexes
test.query_clob:
with aapic as (
    select case
         when (    lower(trim(attribute_02)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(link_attributes)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(value_attributes)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_12)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_21)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_11)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_08)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_03)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_17)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_06)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_22)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_04)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_23)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_14)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_16)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_18)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_10)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(item_attributes)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_09)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_01)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_05)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_13)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_07)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_25)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_15)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_19)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_20)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(attribute_24)) like '%tabindex%' ) then 'N' 
         else 'Y'
       end pass_yn,
       page_id,
       application_id,
       attribute_12,
       attribute_13,
       attribute_14,
       attribute_15,
       attribute_16,
       attribute_17,
       attribute_18,
       attribute_19,
       attribute_20,
       attribute_21,
       attribute_22,
       attribute_23,
       attribute_24,
       attribute_25,
       item_attributes,
       link_attributes,
       value_attributes,
       attribute_01,
       attribute_02,
       attribute_03,
       attribute_04,
       attribute_05,
       attribute_06,
       attribute_07,
       attribute_08,
       attribute_09,
       attribute_10,
       attribute_11,
       last_updated_by,
       last_updated_on,
       build_option,
       name,
       item_type,
       label,
       heading,
       parent_column_id,
       column_id,
	     workspace
    from apex_appl_page_ig_columns
    )
select aapic.pass_yn,                          
       aapic.application_id, 
       aapic.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapic.last_updated_by,
       aapic.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Grid Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has a hard coded tab index', 
        p0 => aapic.heading, 
        p1 => aapic.application_id,
        p2 => aapic.page_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Grid Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has a hard coded tab index', 
        p0 => aapic.heading, 
        p1 => aapic.application_id,
        p2 => aapic.page_id) issue_title,
       aapic.column_id component_id,
       aapic.parent_column_id parent_component_id,
       aapic.heading,
       aapic.label,
       aapic.item_type,
       aapic.name,
			 aapic.workspace
from aapic
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapic.page_id and aap.application_id = aapic.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapic.build_option

test.explanation:
It is inadvisable to alter the default tabindex of elements on a page because it can cause the experience between the sighted and unsighted users to diverge.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.4.3(A) : Focus Order : If a Web page can be navigated sequentially and the navigation sequences affect meaning or operation, focusable components receive focus in an order that preserves meaning and operability.
test.fix: Remove the hard-coded tab index.

test.test_name: Buttons should avoid hardcoded tab indexes
test.query_clob:
with aapb as (
    select case
            when (lower(trim(button_attributes)) like '%tabindex%'
                   or lower(trim(grid_column_attributes)) like '%tabindex%'
                   or lower(trim(image_attributes)) like '%tabindex%' ) then 'N' 
           else 'Y'
           end pass_yn,
           page_id,
           application_id,
           grid_column_attributes,
           image_attributes,
           button_attributes,
           last_updated_by,
           last_updated_on,
           build_option,
           button_name,
           button_id,
	         workspace
      from apex_application_page_buttons
    )
select aapb.pass_yn,                          
       aapb.application_id, 
       aapb.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapb.last_updated_by,
       aapb.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Button `%0` (app %1, page %2) is using a tab index: `%3`', 
        p0 => aapb.button_name, 
        p1 => aapb.application_id,
        p2 => aapb.page_id,
        p3 => aapb.button_attributes) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Button `%0` (app %1, page %2) is using a tab index', 
        p0 => aapb.button_name, 
        p1 => aapb.application_id,
        p2 => aapb.page_id) issue_title,
       aapb.button_id component_id,

       aapb.button_attributes,
			 aapb.workspace
from aapb
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapb.page_id and aap.application_id = aapb.application_id

test.test_name: IG Columns with images have alt text
test.query_clob:
with aapi as (select case
                     when (coalesce((length(lower(attribute_01)) - length(replace(lower(attribute_01),'<img',null)))/4, length(lower(attribute_01)), 0) > 
                              coalesce((length(lower(attribute_01)) - length(replace(lower(attribute_01),'alt="',null)))/5, length(lower(attribute_01)), 0)) or
                              lower(replace(attribute_01,' ','')) like '%alt=""%' or
                              lower(attribute_01) like '% alt %'
                     then 'N'   
                     else 'Y'  
                     end pass_yn,
                     attribute_01 src,
                     application_id,page_id,region_id,
                     heading, last_updated_by,last_updated_on, build_option, parent_column_id, 
							       column_id,
							       workspace
                from apex_appl_page_ig_columns a
                where attribute_01 like '%<img%')
select aapi.pass_yn,                          
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapi.last_updated_by,
       aapi.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Grid Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has an image with no alt text (`%3`)', 
        p0 => aapi.heading, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
        p3 => aapi.src) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Grid Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has an image with no alt text', 
        p0 => aapi.heading, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) issue_title,
       aapi.column_id component_id,
       aapi.parent_column_id parent_component_id,
       aapi.heading,
       aapi.src,
			 aapi.workspace
from aapi
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapi.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapi.application_id
where aapi.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  1.1.1(A) : Non-text Content:

test.test_name: Classic Columns with images have alt text
test.query_clob:
with std as (select case
                     when format_mask like 'IMAGE%' 
                     then 'N' 
                     when (coalesce((length(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION))) - length(replace(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)),'<img',null)))/4, length(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION))), 0) > 
                          coalesce((length(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION))) - length(replace(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)),'alt="',null)))/5, length(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION))), 0)) or
                          replace(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)),' ','') like '%alt=""%' or
                          trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)) like '% alt %' 
                     then 'N' 
                     else 'Y'
                     end pass_yn,
                   HTML_EXPRESSION src,
                   application_id,application_name,page_id,page_name,region_id,region_name, column_alias,
                   last_updated_by, last_updated_on, build_option, heading, region_report_column_id,
						       workspace
            from apex_application_page_rpt_cols a
            where (format_mask like 'IMAGE%' or
                   trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)) like '%<img%'))
select std.pass_yn,                          
       std.application_id, 
       std.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Classic Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has an image with missing alt text: `%3`', 
        p0 => std.heading, 
        p1 => std.application_id,
        p2 => std.page_id,
				p3 => std.src) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Classic Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has an image with missing alt text', 
        p0 => std.heading, 
        p1 => std.application_id,
        p2 => std.page_id) issue_title,
       std.region_report_column_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       std.heading,
			 std.src,
			 std.workspace
from std
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = std.page_id and aap.application_id = std.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = std.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = std.application_id

test.explanation:
Avoid working with focus events in Javascript as it can impact the accessibility of your page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.1.2(A) : No Keyboard Trap:  
    If keyboard focus can be moved to a component of the page using a keyboard interface, then focus can be moved away from that component using only a keyboard interface, and, if it requires more than unmodified arrow or tab keys or other standard exit methods, the user is advised of the method for moving focus away.
test.fix: Remove the offending Javascript.

        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) issue_title,
       aapi.item_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapi.item_name,
       aapi.item_help_text,
			 aapi.workspace
from apex_application_page_items aapi
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapi.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapi.application_id
where aapi.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
HTML that doesn't close tags appropriately is often forgiven by browsers but screen readers can have more trouble. HTML must be checked strictly for appropriately opened and closed tags.

Checking for matching HTML tags. This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  4.1.1(A) : Parsing : In content implemented using markup languages, elements have complete start and end tags, elements are nested according to their specifications, elements do not contain duplicate attributes, and any IDs are unique, except where the specifications allow these features.
test.fix: Fix the HTML

test.test_name: IR Columns should avoid harded tab indexes
test.query_clob:
with aapi as (
    select case
             when (lower(trim(column_link_attr)) like '%tabindex%' ) 
             then 'N' 
             else 'Y'
           end pass_yn,
           page_id,
           application_id,
           column_link_attr,
           created_by,
           created_on,
           updated_by,
           updated_on,
           build_option,
           display_text_as,
           report_label,
           column_alias,
           column_id,
	         workspace
      from apex_application_page_ir_col
    )
select aapi.pass_yn,                          
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       aapi.created_by,
       aapi.created_on,
       aapi.updated_by last_updated_by,
       aapi.updated_on last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has a hardcoded index', 
        p0 => aapi.column_alias, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has a hardcoded index', 
        p0 => aapi.column_alias, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) issue_title,
       aapi.column_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapi.column_alias,
       aapi.report_label,
       aapi.display_text_as,
			 aapi.workspace
from aapi
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapi.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapi.application_id
where aapi.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
It is inadvisable to alter the default tabindex of elements on a page because it can cause the experience between the sighted and unsighted users to diverge.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.4.3(A) : Focus Order : If a Web page can be navigated sequentially and the navigation sequences affect meaning or operation, focusable components receive focus in an order that preserves meaning and operability.
test.fix: Remove the hard-coded tabindex.

test.test_name: Column image links should have alt text
test.query_clob:
select a10.pass_yn,
       a10.application_id,
       a10.page_id,
       a10.region_name,
       a10.column_alias,
       a10.report_label,
       a10.column_linktext,
       a10.column_link_attr,
       a10.created_by, 
       a10.created_on, 
       a10.updated_by last_updated_by, 
       a10.updated_on last_updated_on,
       case when a10.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(
                    p_message => q'^Link Column %1, in report %0, is missing an aria-label. 
                    â€¢ Report Label/Heading : %2
                    â€¢ Link text : %3
                    â€¢ Link attributes : %4.
                    â€¢ Suggestion : 
                         - remove `alt=""` from the Link Text
                         - add `aria-label="edit #YOUR_COLUMN#"` to the Link Attributes
                    ^',
                    p0 => a10.region_name,
                    p1 => a10.column_alias,
                    p2 => a10.report_label,
                    p3 => a10.column_linktext,
                    p4 => a10.column_link_attr
                    )
            end as validation_failure_message,
       case when a10.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => q'^Column %1 (page %0, app %2) is missing an aria-label attribute^',
                                    p0 => a10.page_id,
                                    p1 => a10.column_alias,
                                    p2 => a10.application_id
                                    )
            end as issue_title,
      a10.component_id,
      a10.parent_component_id,
			a10.workspace
from (
     select 
     case when ic1.column_linktext is null
          then 'Y'
          when ic1.column_linktext like '%.png%'
          then case when ic1.column_linktext like '%alt=""%'
                    then 'N'
                    when ic1.column_linktext not like '%aria-label%'
                    then case when ic1.column_link_attr is null 
                            then 'N'
                            when ic1.column_link_attr not like '%aria-label%'
                            then 'N'
                            else 'Y'
                            end
                    else 'Y'
                    end
          else 'Y'
          end pass_yn,
     ic1.application_id,
     ic1.page_id,
     ic1.region_name,
     ic1.column_alias,
     ic1.report_label,
     ic1.column_linktext,
     ic1.column_link_attr,
     ic1.column_id component_id,
     null parent_component_id,
     coalesce(ic1.created_by, app.created_by) created_by, 
     coalesce(ic1.created_on, app.created_on) created_on, 
     coalesce(ic1.updated_by, app.last_updated_by) updated_by, 
     coalesce(ic1.updated_on, app.last_updated_on) updated_on,
	   ic1.workspace
     from apex_application_page_ir_col ic1
     inner join apex_application_pages app on  app.page_id = ic1.page_id
                                           and app.application_id = ic1.application_id
     inner join  v_svt_apex_applications aa on ic1.application_id = aa.application_id
                                        and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
                                        and ic1.column_linktext is not null
	   where ic1.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
) a10
test.explanation:
Column image links should have accessible alt text : Link columns in reports that do not feature text (eg. they have the pencil symbol) should include "Alt" text. This alt-text will be displayed by a screen-reader in the web-elements rotor, "link"section.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  1.1.1(A) : Non-text Content:  
    All non-text content that is presented to the user has a text alternative that serves the equivalent purpose, except for the situations listed below.
test.fix: Add some descriptive text to your alt text. You are encouraged to use substitution variables. For eg: ``

test.test_name: Check page JS for on blur events
test.query_clob:
with aap as (select case
                     when (lower(trim(JAVASCRIPT_CODE)) like '%blur%'
                           or lower(trim(JAVASCRIPT_CODE)) like '%focusout%'
                           or lower(trim(JAVASCRIPT_CODE_ONLOAD)) like '%blur%'
                           or lower(trim(JAVASCRIPT_CODE_ONLOAD)) like '%focusout%') 
                     then 'N' 
                     else 'Y'
                     end pass_yn,
                     page_name,
                     application_id,
                     JAVASCRIPT_CODE,
                     JAVASCRIPT_CODE_ONLOAD,
                     created_by,
                     created_on,
                     last_updated_by,
                     last_updated_on,
                     build_option,
                     page_mode,
                     page_id,
						         workspace
            from apex_application_pages)
select aap.pass_yn,                          
       aap.application_id, 
       aap.page_id,
       aap.created_by,
       aap.created_on,
       aap.last_updated_by,
       aap.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) uses a blur event, which is not accessible', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) uses a blur event', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) issue_title,
       aap.page_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aap.page_name,
       aap.page_mode,
			 aap.workspace
from aap
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aap.application_id
where aap.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
Avoid using or affecting blur events in javascript as it can impact the accessibility of your page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.3.3(AAA) : Pause, Stop, Hide: Animation from Interactions: Motion animation triggered by interaction can be disabled, unless the animation is essential to the functionality or the information being conveyed.
test.fix: Remove the offending Javascript.

test.test_name: Page item labels  + region names must be unique
test.query_clob:
with aapi as (select   dense_rank() over (partition by application_id, page_id, region, trim(lower(label)) order by display_sequence nulls last) therank,
                       application_id, 
                       page_id, 
                       item_name,
                       label,
                       display_sequence,
                       build_option, 
                       item_id,
                       last_updated_on,
                       last_updated_by,
                        workspace,
                        region
              from apex_application_page_items
              where display_as_code not in ('NATIVE_HIDDEN')
             )
select 'N' pass_yn,                          
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapi.last_updated_by,
       aapi.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('There is more than one Page Item `%3` (`%0`) in a region named `%4` on page %2 (app %1). Page item labels must be unique for accessibility.', 
        p0 => aapi.item_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
        p3 => aapi.label,
        p4 => aapi.region) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('There is > 1 Page Item label `%0` (`%3`) in a region called `%4` on page %2 (app %1).', 
        p0 => aapi.label, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
        p3 => aapi.item_name,
        p4 => aapi.region) issue_title,
       aapi.item_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapi.item_name,
       aapi.workspace,
       aapi.region,
       aapi.therank
from aapi
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapi.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapi.application_id
where aapi.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and aapi.therank = 2
test.explanation:
Screen-readers announce page items in the context of their parent region. Consequently, the combination of page item labels and region names must be unique per page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.5.3(A) : Label in Name: For user interface components with labels that include text or images of text, the name contains the text that is presented visually.
2.  3.3.2(A) : Labels or Instructions:  
    Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input.
3.  4.1.2(A) : Name, Role, Value : For all user interface components (including but not limited to: form elements, links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be programmatically determined; states, properties, and values that can be set by the user can be programmatically set; and notification of changes to these items is available to user agents, including assistive technologies.
4.  2.4.6(AA) : Headings and labels describe topic or purpose.
test.fix: Change the page item label or the region name to be unique

test.test_name: Page names should be unique
test.query_clob:
with aap as (select application_id,
                    page_id,
                    lower(trim(page_name)) lower_case_page_name,
                    ROW_NUMBER( ) OVER (PARTITION BY workspace, application_id,lower(trim(page_name)) ORDER BY page_id NULLS LAST) value_dup_cnt,
                    created_by,
                    created_on,
                    last_updated_by,
                    last_updated_on,
                    build_option,
                    page_mode,
                    page_name,
						        workspace
            from apex_application_pages)
select case when aap.value_dup_cnt > 1 
            then 'N' 
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,                          
       aap.application_id, 
       aap.page_id,
       aap.created_by,
       aap.created_on,
       aap.last_updated_by,
       aap.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) is not unique. Page names should be unique for accessibility.', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) is not unique', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) issue_title,
       aap.page_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aap.page_name,
       aap.page_mode,
			 aap.workspace
from aap
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aap.application_id
where aap.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
This plausibly affects sighted users as much as screen-reader users. Page names should be unique for clarity.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.4.2(A) : Page Titled:  
    Web pages have titles that describe topic or purpose.
test.fix: Make the page name unique

test.test_name: DA should avoid js that is setting intervals or timeouts
test.query_clob:
with aapd as (select case
                      when ((lower(trim(attribute_01)) like '%setinterval%'
                             or lower(trim(attribute_01)) like '%settimeout%'
                             or lower(trim(attribute_01)) like '%setinterval%'
                             or lower(trim(attribute_01)) like '%settimeout%')) 
                      then 'N' 
                      else 'Y'
                    end pass_yn,
                    application_id,
                    page_id,
                    dynamic_action_name,
                    action_pd_name,
                    dynamic_action_event_result,
                    last_updated_by,
                    last_updated_on,
                    build_option,
                    dynamic_action_id,
                    action_id,
                    attribute_01,
							      workspace
            from apex_application_page_da_acts a
            where action_code = 'NATIVE_JAVASCRIPT_CODE')
select aapd.pass_yn,                          
       aapd.application_id, 
       aapd.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapd.last_updated_by,
       aapd.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Dynamic Action Action `%0` (app %1, page %2) has js that is setting intervals or timeouts : `%3`', 
        p0 => aapd.dynamic_action_name, 
        p1 => aapd.application_id,
        p2 => aapd.page_id,
        p3 => substr(attribute_01,1,50)) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Dynamic Action Action `%0` (app %1, page %2) has js that is not accessible', 
        p0 => aapd.dynamic_action_name, 
        p1 => aapd.application_id,
        p2 => aapd.page_id) issue_title,
       aapd.action_id component_id,
       aapd.dynamic_action_id parent_component_id,
       aapd.dynamic_action_name,
       aapd.attribute_01,
			 aapd.workspace
from aapd
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapd.page_id and aap.application_id = aapd.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapd.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapd.application_id
where aapd.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
Avoid setting intervals and timeouts with Javascript as it can impact the accessibility of your page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.2.2(A) : Pause, Stop, Hide:  
    For moving, blinking, scrolling, or auto-updating information, all of the following are true:
    
    Moving, blinking, scrolling  
    For any moving, blinking or scrolling information that (1) starts automatically, (2) lasts more than five seconds, and (3) is presented in parallel with other content, there is a mechanism for the user to pause, stop, or hide it unless the movement, blinking, or scrolling is part of an activity where it is essential; and
    
    Auto-updating  
    For any auto-updating information that (1) starts automatically and (2) is presented in parallel with other content, there is a mechanism for the user to pause, stop, or hide it or to control the frequency of the update unless the auto-updating is part of an activity where it is essential.
    
2.  2.3.1(A) : Three Flashes or Below Threshold:  
    Web pages do not contain anything that flashes more than three times in any one second period, or the flash is below the general flash and red flash thr~
test.fix: Remove the offending javascript.

test.test_name: IG should avoid custom shortcuts
test.query_clob:
with aapi as (select case
                     when lower(trim(javascript_code)) like '%shortcut%' then 'N' 
                     else 'Y'
                   end pass_yn,
                   javascript_code,
                   application_id,
                   page_id,
                   last_updated_by,
                   last_updated_on,
                   workspace,
                   region_name,
                   interactive_grid_id
            from apex_appl_page_igs)

       aapi.workspace,
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapi.last_updated_by,
       aapi.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Grid `%0` (app %1, page %2) is defining a custom shortcut: `%3%`', 
        p0 => aapi.region_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
        p3 => aapi.javascript_code) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Grid `%0` (app %1, page %2) has a custom shortcut', 
        p0 => aapi.region_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) issue_title,
       aapi.interactive_grid_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapi.region_name,
       aapi.javascript_code
from aapi
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id
                                      and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on  aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
where aapi.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
Avoid setting custom shortcuts with Javascript as it can impact the accessibility of your page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.1.4(A) : Character Key Shortcuts :
    
    If a keyboard shortcut is implemented in content using only letter (including upper- and lower-case letters), punctuation, number, or symbol characters, then at least one of the following is true:
    
    Turn off  
    A mechanism is available to turn the shortcut off;  
    Remap  
    A mechanism is available to remap the shortcut to use one or more non-printable keyboard characters (e.g. Ctrl, Alt, etc);  
    Active only on focus  
    The keyboard shortcut for a user interface component is only active when that component has focus.
test.fix: Remove the offending javascript.

                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id

                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapi.application_id

test.explanation:
Page Item labels cannot be blank (null / only spaces / \`&nbsp\`) otherwise screen readers cannot announce them correctly.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.5.3(A) : Label in Name: For user interface components with labels that include text or images of text, the name contains the text that is presented visually.
2.  3.3.2(A) : Labels or Instructions:  
    Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input.
3.  4.1.2(A) : Name, Role, Value : For all user interface components (including but not limited to: form elements, links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be programmatically determined; states, properties, and values that can be set by the user can be programmatically set; and notification of changes to these items is available to user agents, including assistive technologies.
4.  2.4.6(AA) : Headings and labels describe topic or purpose.

test.test_name: DA should avoid mouse events

                 else 'Y'
               end pass_yn,
               application_id,
               page_id,
               dynamic_action_name,
               dynamic_action_id,
               last_updated_by,
               last_updated_on,
               build_option,
               when_event_name,
	             workspace
        from apex_application_page_da
    )
select aapd.pass_yn,                          
       aapd.application_id, 
       aapd.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapd.last_updated_by,
       aapd.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Dynamic Action `%0` (app %1, page %2) uses an inaccessible mouse event: `%3`', 
        p0 => aapd.dynamic_action_name, 
        p1 => aapd.application_id,
        p2 => aapd.page_id,
        p3 => aapd.when_event_name) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Dynamic Action `%0` (app %1, page %2) uses an inaccessible mouse event', 
        p0 => aapd.dynamic_action_name, 
        p1 => aapd.application_id,
        p2 => aapd.page_id) issue_title,
       aapd.dynamic_action_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapd.dynamic_action_name,
       aapd.when_event_name,
			 aapd.workspace
from aapd
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapd.page_id and aap.application_id = aapd.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapd.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapd.application_id
where aapd.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
Avoid using mousevents in Javascript as it can impact the accessibility of your page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.5.2(A) : Pointer Cancellation:  
    For functionality that can be operated using a single pointer, at least one of the following is true:
    
    No Down-Event  
    The down-event of the pointer is not used to execute any part of the function;  
    Abort or Undo  
    Completion of the function is on the up-event, and a mechanism is available to abort the function before completion or to undo the function after completion;  
    Up Reversal  
    The up-event reverses any outcome of the preceding down-event;  
    Essential  
    Completing the function on the down-event is essential.
test.fix: Remove the offending javascript.

        p0 => aats.name, 
        p1 => aats.application_id) validation_failure_message,

where aats.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
test.explanation:
Avoid animation or blinking as it can impact the accessibility of your page.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.2.2(A) : Pause, Stop, Hide:  
    For moving, blinking, scrolling, or auto-updating information, all of the following are true:
    
    Moving, blinking, scrolling  
    For any moving, blinking or scrolling information that (1) starts automatically, (2) lasts more than five seconds, and (3) is presented in parallel with other content, there is a mechanism for the user to pause, stop, or hide it unless the movement, blinking, or scrolling is part of an activity where it is essential; and
    
    Auto-updating  
    For any auto-updating information that (1) starts automatically and (2) is presented in parallel with other content, there is a mechanism for the user to pause, stop, or hide it or to control the frequency of the update unless the auto-updating is part of an activity where it is essential.
    
2.  2.3.1(A) : Three Flashes or Below Threshold:  
    Web pages do not contain anything that flashes more than three times in any one second period, or the flash is below the general flash and red flash thr~
test.fix: Remove any reference to blinking or animation from the Theme Roller configuration.

test.test_name: Page Help HTML is well formed
test.query_clob:
select svt_stds_parser.valid_html_yn(aap.help_text) pass_yn,
       aap.workspace workspace,
       aap.application_id,

        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id,
        p3 => substr(aap.help_text,1,50)) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) has malformed HTML',

test.explanation:
HTML that doesn't close tags appropriately is often forgiven by browsers but screen readers can have more trouble. HTML must be checked strictly for appropriately opened and closed tags.

Checking for matching HTML tags. This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  4.1.1(A) : Parsing : In content implemented using markup languages, elements have complete start and end tags, elements are nested according to their specifications, elements do not contain duplicate attributes, and any IDs are unique, except where the specifications allow these features.

test.test_name: Classic Report column headings are unique per region
test.query_clob:
with aapr as (select   row_number( ) over (partition by application_id,page_id,region_id,trim(lower(heading)) order by display_sequence nulls last) value_dup_cnt,
                       application_id,
                       page_id,
                       region_id,
                       region_name,
                       heading,
                       display_sequence,
                       build_option,
                       last_updated_by,
                       last_updated_on,
                       column_alias,
                       region_report_column_id,
							         workspace
            from apex_application_page_rpt_cols
            where column_is_hidden = 'No'
            )
select case when aapr.value_dup_cnt > 1 
           then 'N' 
           else 'Y'
           end pass_yn,                          
       aapr.application_id, 
       aapr.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapr.last_updated_by,
       aapr.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Classic Report Column `%0` (col `%3`, app %1, page %2) is not unique. Column heading need to be unique for accessibility.', 
        p0 => aapr.heading, 
        p1 => aapr.application_id,
        p2 => aapr.page_id,
        p3 => aapr.column_alias) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Classic Report Column `%0` (col `%3`, app %1, page %2) is not unique.', 
        p0 => aapr.heading, 
        p1 => aapr.application_id,
        p2 => aapr.page_id,
        p3 => aapr.column_alias) issue_title,
       aapr.region_report_column_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapr.heading,
       aapr.column_alias,
			 aapr.workspace
from aapr
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapr.page_id and aap.application_id = aapr.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapr.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapr.application_id
where aapr.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
This plausibly affects sighted users as much as screen-reader users. Column headings should be unique for clarity.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.5.3(A) : Label in Name: For user interface components with labels that include text or images of text, the name contains the text that is presented visually.
2.  3.3.2(A) : Labels or Instructions:  
    Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input.
3.  4.1.2(A) : Name, Role, Value : For all user interface components (including but not limited to: form elements, links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be programmatically determined; states, properties, and values that can be set by the user can be programmatically set; and notification of changes to these items is available to user agents, including assistive technologies.
4.  2.4.6(AA) : Headings and labels describe topic or purpose.
test.fix: Make the column headings unique per region

with aap as (

       aap.last_updated_by,
       aap.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) has inaccessible js',

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.5.2(A) : Pointer Cancellation:

    Up Reversal

test.test_name: Some fields benefit from an autocomplete attribute
test.query_clob:
with aapi as (select case
                     when (lower(trim(html_form_element_attributes)) not like '%autocomplete%'
                           or trim(html_form_element_attributes) is null) 
                     then 'N' 
                     else 'Y'
                   end pass_yn,
                   application_id,
                   application_name, 
                   page_id, 
                   page_name,
                   region, 
                   item_name,
                   html_form_element_attributes,
                   label,
                   workspace,
                   last_updated_by,
                   last_updated_on,
                   build_option,
                   item_help_text,
                   item_id,
                   display_as,
                   display_as_code
             from apex_application_page_items
             where display_as_code not in ('NATIVE_HIDDEN','NATIVE_CHECKBOX','NATIVE_SINGLE_CHECKBOX', 'NATIVE_RADIOGROUP','NATIVE_YES_NO')
						 and lower(item_name) not like '%api%'
						 and lower(item_name) not like '%addressed%'
             and (
                    (lower(label) like '%name%' and (lower(label) like '%first%' or lower(label) like '%last%' or lower(label) like '%family%'))
                    or 
                    (lower(label) like '%address%')
                    or 
                    (lower(label) like '%phone number%')
                    or 
                    (lower(label) like '%mail%')
                    or 
                    (lower(label) like '%birthday%' or lower(label) like '%bday%')
                 )
 )
select aapi.pass_yn,
       aapi.workspace workspace,
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapi.last_updated_by,
       aapi.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('`%3`/`%5` Page Item `%0`/`%4` (app %1, page %2) could benefit from an autocomplete attribute', 
        p0 => aapi.item_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
        p3 => aapi.display_as,
        p4 => aapi.label,
        p5 => aapi.display_as_code) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page Item `%0` (app %1, page %2) is missing autocomplete', 
        p0 => aapi.item_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) issue_title,
       aapi.item_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapi.item_name,
       aapi.item_help_text,
       aapi.display_as,
       aapi.display_as_code,
       aapi.label,
       esa.type_code
from aapi
inner join v_svt_stds_applications esa on aapi.application_id = esa.apex_app_id
																			 and esa.type_code in ('HUMANX')
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id
                                      and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on  aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on  aabo2.build_option_name = aapi.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapi.application_id
where aapi.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
If you are soliciting routine information like name, address, contact info, etc - you can prompt the browser to supply the stored information for the user. This can be big help to all users and users with accessibility-needs especially.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  1.3.5(AA) : Identify Input Purpose:
    
    The purpose of each input field collecting information about the user can be programmatically determined when:
    
    The input field serves a purpose identified in the Input Purposes for User Interface Components section; and  
    The content is implemented using technologies with support for identifying the expected meaning for form input data.
test.fix: Add the appropriate [autocomplete attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete). For example, add `autocomplete="email"`  to the `Custom Attributes` field

test.test_name: Page report columns should avoid tab indexes
test.query_clob:
with aapr as (
    select case
         when (lower(trim(ATTRIBUTE_09)) like '%tabindex%'
                or lower(trim(ATTRIBUTE_06)) like '%tabindex%'

test.test_name: IR Columns with images have alt text
test.query_clob:
with aapi as (select case
                     when format_mask like 'IMAGE%' 
                     then 'N' 
                     when (coalesce((length(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION))) - length(replace(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)),'<img',null)))/4, length(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION))), 0) > 
                          coalesce((length(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION))) - length(replace(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)),'alt="',null)))/5, length(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION))), 0)) or
                          replace(trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)),' ','') like '%alt=""%' or
                          trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)) like '% alt %' 
                     then 'N' 
                     else 'Y'
                   end pass_yn,
							     HTML_EXPRESSION src,
                   application_id,page_id,region_id,column_alias,
                   created_by,created_on,updated_on,updated_by, build_option, column_id,
							     workspace
            from apex_application_page_ir_col
            where (format_mask like 'IMAGE%' or
                   trim(lower(HTML_EXPRESSION)) like '%<img%'))
select aapi.pass_yn,                          
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       aapi.created_by,
       aapi.created_on,
       aapi.updated_on last_updated_by,
       aapi.updated_by last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has image with no alt text (`%3`)', 
        p0 => aapi.column_alias, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
				p3 => aapi.src) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has image with no alt text', 
        p0 => aapi.column_alias, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id) issue_title,
       aapi.column_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapi.column_alias,
			 aapi.src,
			 aapi.workspace
from aapi
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option

test.explanation:
This plausibly affects sighted users as much as screen-reader users. Column headings should not be blank for clarity.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.5.3(A) : Label in Name: For user interface components with labels that include text or images of text, the name contains the text that is presented visually.
2.  3.3.2(A) : Labels or Instructions:  
    Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input.
3.  4.1.2(A) : Name, Role, Value : For all user interface components (including but not limited to: form elements, links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be programmatically determined; states, properties, and values that can be set by the user can be programmatically set; and notification of changes to these items is available to user agents, including assistive technologies.
4.  2.4.6(AA) : Headings and labels describe topic or purpose.
test.fix: Provide a descriptive column heading

test.test_name: Pages should avoid inline CSS for blinking or animation logic
test.query_clob:
with aap as (select case
                 when (lower(trim(inline_css)) like '%blink%'
                       or lower(trim(inline_css)) like '%animation%') then 'N' 
                 else 'Y'
                 end pass_yn,
                 page_id,
                 inline_css,
                 created_by,
                 created_on,

                 page_name,

						     workspace
          from apex_application_pages a)

       aap.application_id, 
       aap.page_id,
       aap.created_by,
       aap.created_on,
       aap.last_updated_by,
       aap.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) has inaccessible css: `%3`', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id,
        p3 => substr(aap.inline_css,1,50)) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2)has inaccessible css', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) issue_title,
       aap.page_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aap.page_name,
       aap.page_mode,
       aap.inline_css,
			 aap.workspace
from aap
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aap.application_id
where aap.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
