test.test_name: Page Items should be available
test.query_clob:
with std as (
    select case when months_between (sysdate, api.last_updated_on) > svt_preferences.get('SVT_CLEANUP_DELAY')
                then case when api.condition_type = 'Never'
                          then 'NEVERCONPAGEITEM'
                          end
                end child_code,
           api.condition_type,
           api.application_id,
           api.page_id,
           api.item_id component_id,
           api.item_name,
           api.last_updated_by,
           api.last_updated_on,
           api.build_option,
	         api.workspace
    from apex_application_page_items api
	  where api.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
)
select case when std.child_code is null 
            then 'Y'
            else 'N'
            end pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('Item `%0` (page %1, app %2) should be available or deleted (%3). It has been unavailable since `%4`',
                          p0 => std.item_name,
                          p1 => std.page_id,
                          p2 => std.application_id,
                          p3 => case when std.child_code = 'NEVERCONPAGEITEM'
                                     then 'Never condition'
                                     end,
                          p4 => to_char(std.last_updated_on, 'DD-MON-YY')
                        ) 
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('Item `%0` (page %1, app %2) should be available',
                          p0 => std.item_name,
                          p1 => std.page_id,
                          p2 => std.application_id) 
            end issue_title,
	   std.child_code,
		 std.component_id,
		 null parent_component_id,
		 std.workspace
from std
test.explanation: Page Items should be made available or deleted : Page regions and items that have had their Server-Side Condition set to "Never" (for whatever reason), should be removed. Including these items/regions just creates unnecessary app bloat.
test.fix: Make item available or delete it

test.test_name: Applications are available
test.query_clob:
select a2.pass_yn, 
       a2.application_id, 
			 null page_id,
       a2.application_group,
       a2.availability_status,
       a2.created_by, 
       a2.created_on, 
       a2.last_updated_by, 
       a2.last_updated_on,
       case when a2.pass_yn = 'N'
            then issue_desc||' (this is only acceptable temporarily).'
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when a2.pass_yn = 'N'
            then issue_desc

            end issue_title,
			a2.application_id component_id,
      null parent_component_id,
			a2.workspace
from (
     select 
     case when aa.application_group = 'TO BE ARCHIVED' or aa.availability_status = 'Unavailable'
          then 'N'
          else 'Y'
          end pass_yn,
     aa.application_id,
     aa.application_group,
     aa.availability_status,
     aa.authorization_scheme,
     aa.created_by, 
     aa.created_on, 
     aa.last_updated_by, 
     aa.last_updated_on,
     apex_string.format(p_message => q'^Application %0 is unavailable^',
                        p0 => aa.application_id) issue_desc,
     aa.workspace
     from v_svt_apex_applications aa
	   where aa.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
) a2
test.explanation: APEX applications should be available and active : Workspaces should be populated by active applications
test.fix: Either make the application available or archive it (delete it)

test.test_name: Page dynamic actions should be available
test.query_clob:
with std as (
    select case when months_between (sysdate, apd.last_updated_on) > svt_preferences.get('SVT_CLEANUP_DELAY')
                then case when apd.condition_type = 'Never'
                          then 'NEVERPAGEDA'
                          end
                end child_code,
           apd.condition_type,
           apd.application_id,
           apd.page_id,
           apd.dynamic_action_name element_name,
           apd.last_updated_by,
           apd.last_updated_on,
           apd.build_option,
           abo.build_option_status,
           abo.status_on_export,
	         apd.workspace
    from apex_application_page_da apd
    inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.application_id = apd.application_id
                                          and aap.page_id = apd.page_id
    left outer join apex_application_build_options abo on abo.application_id = aap.application_id 
                                                       and abo.build_option_name = aap.build_option
    where apd.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
	  and coalesce(abo.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
)
select case when std.child_code is null 
            then 'Y'
            else 'N'
            end pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('%0 (page %1, app %2) should be made available or deleted. It has been unavailable since `%4`',
                          p0 => case when std.child_code = 'NEVERPAGEBRANCH'
                                     then 'Branch with Never condition `'||std.element_name||'`'
                                     when std.child_code = 'NEVERPAGECOMP'
                                     then 'Computation with Never condition `'||std.element_name||'`'
                                     when std.child_code = 'NEVERPAGEDA'
                                     then 'Dynamic Action with Never condition `'||std.element_name||'`'
                                     end,
                          p1 => std.page_id,
                          p2 => std.application_id,
                          p4 => to_char(std.last_updated_on, 'DD-MON-YY')
                        ) 
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('%0 (page %1, app %2) has been unavailable for too long',
                          p0 => case when std.child_code = 'NEVERPAGEBRANCH'
                                     then 'Branch with Never condition `'||std.element_name||'`'
                                     end,
                          p1 => std.page_id,
                          p2 => std.application_id,
                          p4 => to_char(std.last_updated_on, 'DD-MON-YY')
                        ) 
            end issue_title,
	     std.child_code,
       std.element_name,
			 std.page_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
			 std.workspace
from std
test.explanation: NEVERPAGEDA : Page dynamic actions that have had their Server-Side Condition set to "Never" (for whatever reason), should be removed. Including these items/regions just creates unnecessary app bloat.
test.fix: *   Make available or remove

                                     then 'Computation with Never condition `'||std.element_name||'`'

                                     then 'Dynamic Action with Never condition `'||std.element_name||'`'
                                     end,
                          p1 => std.page_id,
                          p2 => std.application_id,
                          p4 => to_char(std.last_updated_on, 'DD-MON-YY')
                        ) 
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('%0 (page %1, app %2) has been unavailable for too long',
                          p0 => case when std.child_code = 'NEVERPAGEBRANCH'
                                     then 'Branch with Never condition `'||std.element_name||'`'
                                     end,
                          p1 => std.page_id,
                          p2 => std.application_id,
                          p4 => to_char(std.last_updated_on, 'DD-MON-YY')
                        ) 
            end issue_title,
	     std.child_code,
       std.element_name,
			 std.page_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
			 std.workspace
from std
test.explanation: NEVERPAGECOMP : Page computations that have had their Server-Side Condition set to "Never" (for whatever reason), should be removed. Including these items/regions just creates unnecessary app bloat.
test.fix: *   Make available or remove

test.test_name: List entries should have valid build options
test.query_clob:
select 
a80.pass_yn,
a80.application_id,
null page_id,
a80.child_code,
a80.created_on,
a80.created_by,
a80.last_updated_by, 
a80.last_updated_on,
case when a80.child_code = 'VAL_BUILD_LIST_ENTRY'
     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^List entry (%3,%2) in list (%1, %0) has an invalid build option: %4 / %5^',
     p0 => a80.component_id,
     p1 => a80.list_name,
     p2 => a80.entry_text,
     p3 => a80.entry_target,
     p4 => a80.build_option,
     p5 => a80.build_option_status
     )
     when a80.child_code = 'LIST_ENTRY_BUILD_ABUSE'
     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^List entry (%3,%2) in list (%1, %0) Excluded by build option for too long: %4 / %5^',
     p0 => a80.component_id,
     p1 => a80.list_name,
     p2 => a80.entry_text,
     p3 => a80.entry_target,
     p4 => a80.build_option,
     p5 => a80.build_option_status
     )
     end as validation_failure_message,
case when a80.child_code = 'VAL_BUILD_LIST_ENTRY'
     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^Invalid build option for list entry (%2) in list (%1) in app %3^',
     p0 => a80.component_id,
     p1 => a80.list_name,
     p2 => a80.entry_text,
     p3 => a80.application_id
     )
     when a80.child_code = 'LIST_ENTRY_BUILD_ABUSE'
     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^List entry (%2) Excluded by Build Option for too long - in list (%1) in app %3^',
     p0 => a80.component_id,
     p1 => a80.list_name,
     p2 => a80.entry_text,
     p3 => a80.application_id
     )
     end as issue_title,
a80.component_id,
a80.parent_component_id,
a80.workspace
from (
     select
     case when bo.status_on_export = 'Exclude'
          then case when ale.last_updated_on is null 
                    then 'N'
                    when months_between (sysdate, ale.last_updated_on) > svt_preferences.get('SVT_CLEANUP_DELAY')
                    then 'N'
                    else 'Y'
                    end
          when ale.build_option is null
          then 'Y'
          when validate_conversion(ale.build_option as number) = 1 
          then 'N'
          else 'Y'
          end pass_yn,
     ale.application_id,
     case when bo.status_on_export = 'Exclude'
          then case when ale.last_updated_on is null 
                    then 'LIST_ENTRY_BUILD_ABUSE'
                    when months_between (sysdate, ale.last_updated_on) > svt_preferences.get('SVT_CLEANUP_DELAY')
                    then 'LIST_ENTRY_BUILD_ABUSE'
                    end
          when ale.build_option is null
          then null
          when validate_conversion(ale.build_option as number) = 1 
          then 'VAL_BUILD_LIST_ENTRY'
          end child_code,
     ale.list_entry_id component_id,
     ale.list_entry_parent_id parent_component_id,
     ale.list_name,
     ale.entry_text,
     ale.entry_target,
     ale.build_option,
     aa.created_on,
     aa.created_by,
     ale.last_updated_by, 
     ale.last_updated_on,
     bo.build_option_status,
	   bo.status_on_export,
	   ale.workspace
     from apex_application_list_entries ale
     inner join v_svt_apex_applications aa on  ale.application_id = aa.application_id
                                       and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
     left join apex_application_build_options bo on  ale.application_id = bo.application_id
                                                 and ale.build_option = bo.build_option_name
	   where ale.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
) a80
test.explanation:
\[List Build Entries are invalid\]

*   LIST\_ENTRY\_BUILD\_ABUSE : List Entry Excluded by Build Option for too long
*   VAL\_BUILD\_LIST\_ENTRY : The build option on this list entry is in an invalid state
test.fix:
*   LIST\_ENTRY\_BUILD\_ABUSE : Remove the build or eliminate the page
*   VAL\_BUILD\_LIST\_ENTRY : Remove or replace the build option

test.test_name: Pages should limit their content
test.query_clob:
with tmr as (select workspace, application_id, page_id, count(*) region_count
            from apex_application_page_regions
            having count(*) >= 50
            group by workspace, application_id, page_id)
select 'N'  pass_yn,
       tmr.application_id,
       tmr.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aap.last_updated_by,
       aap.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page %0 (app %1) has %2 regions. It is not recommended to have more than 20. Consider dividing the content between several pages.',
                          p0 => tmr.application_id,
                          p1 => tmr.page_id,
                          p2 => tmr.region_count) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page %0 (app %1) has too many regions',
                          tmr.application_id,
                          tmr.page_id) issue_title,
       tmr.region_count,
			 aap.build_option,
       abo.build_option_status,
       abo.status_on_export,
       tmr.page_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
			 tmr.workspace
from tmr
inner join apex_application_pages aap on  tmr.application_id = aap.application_id
                                      and tmr.page_id = aap.page_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options abo on abo.application_id = aap.application_id 
                                                   and abo.build_option_name = aap.build_option
where tmr.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(abo.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation: A page should not have more than 20 regions : Most reasonably complex pages should have no more than 20 regions per page. Only in extremely rare conditions should a page have more than 50 regions. Pages with more than 50 regions should be refactored into multiple pages.
test.fix: Consider dividing the content between several pages

test.test_name: Themes should be specific numbers and subscribed
test.query_clob:
with std as (select aats.theme_number, 
                    aats.subscribed_from, 
                    aats.is_subscribed,
                    case when aats.theme_number not in (42,1000)
                            then 'WRONGTHEME'
                            when aats.subscribed_from is null 
                            then 'NOSUBSCRIPTION'
                            when aats.theme_number = 1000
                            then case when aats.subscribed_from != '9000. Redwood (Sky)'
                                      then 'WRONGSUBSCRIPTION'
                                      end
                            else null
                            end child_code, 
                    aats.application_id, 
                    null page_id,
                    aats.created_by,
                    aats.created_on,
                    aats.last_updated_by,
                    aats.last_updated_on,
                    aats.theme_style_id component_id, 
                    null parent_component_id,
						        aats.workspace
            from apex_application_theme_styles aats
						where aats.is_current = 'Yes'
						and aats.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE'))
select case when std.child_code is not null 
            then 'N'
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,
       std.application_id, 
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('The theme of App %0 %1',
                          p0 => std.application_id,
                          p1 => case when std.child_code = 'WRONGTHEME'
                                     then 'is not an approved theme number. The theme number is '||std.theme_number||' but should be 42 or 1000'
                                     when std.child_code = 'NOSUBSCRIPTION'
                                     then 'is not subscribed to a master theme or the theme may need refreshing'
                                     when std.child_code = 'WRONGSUBSCRIPTION'
                                     then 'is subscribed to the wrong master theme (`'||std.subscribed_from||'`). It should be subscribed to `9000. Redwood (Sky)`'
                                     end
                ) 
            end validation_failure_message, 
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('The theme of App %0 %1',
                          p0 => std.application_id,
                          p1 => case when std.child_code = 'WRONGTHEME'
                                     then 'is not an approved theme number'
                                     when std.child_code = 'NOSUBSCRIPTION'
                                     then 'is not subscribed to a master theme'
                                     when std.child_code = 'WRONGSUBSCRIPTION'
                                     then 'is subscribed to the wrong master theme'
                                     end
                ) 
            end issue_title,
       std.child_code, 
       std.component_id, 
       std.parent_component_id,
			 std.workspace
from std
test.explanation:
Themes should be subscribed and be 42 or 1000 :

*   THEME\_SUBSCRIPTION : Apps with Redwood should be subscribed to app 9000
*   WRONGTHEME : The only approved theme numbers are 42 and 1000
*   NOSUBSCRIPTION : Restore theme subscription or refresh it
test.fix:
Try refreshing the theme if everything "looks" correct.

*   THEME\_SUBSCRIPTION : Apps with Redwood should be subscribed to app 1000
*   WRONGTHEME : The only approved theme numbers are 42 and 1000
*   NOSUBSCRIPTION : Restore theme subscription or refresh it

test.query_clob:
select 
a90.pass_yn,

a90.page_name,
a90.created_by,

     )

     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^Excluded by Build Option for too long (%0 / %1)^',

     )

case when a90.child_code = 'VAL_PAGE_BUILD'
     then apex_string.format(p_message =>

     p2 => a90.application_id,

     )
     when a90.child_code = 'PAGE_BUILD_ABUSE'
     then apex_string.format(p_message =>

     p1 => a90.build_option_status,

     )

a90.page_id component_id,
null parent_component_id,

from (
     select
     case when bo.status_on_export = 'Exclude'
          then case when aap.last_updated_on is null

                    then 'N'

                    end

          then 'Y'

     aap.application_id,
     case when bo.status_on_export = 'Exclude'
          then case when aap.last_updated_on is null

                    then 'PAGE_BUILD_ABUSE'
                    end
          when aap.build_option is null
          then null

          end child_code,
     aap.page_id,
     aap.page_name,
     aap.build_option,

test.test_name: IG Icon View Links need aria-labels
test.query_clob:
with aapi as (
        select case when (lower(trim(icon_view_link_attributes)) not like '%aria-label%') 
                    then 'N' 
                    else 'Y'
                    end pass_yn,
               page_id,
               application_id,
               icon_view_link_attributes,
               workspace,
               last_updated_by,
               last_updated_on,
               region_name,
               interactive_grid_id
         from apex_appl_page_igs
         where icon_view_icon_attributes is not null
    )
select aapi.pass_yn,
       aapi.workspace,
       aapi.application_id, 
       aapi.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapi.last_updated_by,
       aapi.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Grid `%0` (app %1, page %2) icon view is missing aria-label : `%3`', 
        p0 => aapi.region_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
        p3 => aapi.icon_view_link_attributes) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Interactive Grid `%0` icon view is missing an aria-label (app %1, page %2, grid id %3)', 
        p0 => aapi.region_name, 
        p1 => aapi.application_id,
        p2 => aapi.page_id,
				p3 => aapi.interactive_grid_id) issue_title,
       aapi.interactive_grid_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapi.region_name
from aapi
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id
                                      and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on  aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
where aapi.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
Links must have aria-labels so that screen-readers can correctly identify their purpose.

Note: There is debate about whether the addition of a `title` tag is beneficial.

This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  2.4.4(A) : Link Purpose (In Context) :  
    The purpose of each link can be determined from the link text alone or from the link text together with its programmatically determined link context, except where the purpose of the link would be ambiguous to users in general.
test.fix: Add something like `aria-label = "Edit  #USER_NAME#"`

test.test_name: IR detail link must contain aria-labels
test.query_clob:
with aapi as (select lower(trim(detail_link_attributes))||detail_link_text src,
                  page_id,
                  application_id,
                  region_name,
                  detail_link_attributes,
                  detail_link_target,
                  detail_link_text,
                  region_id,
                  created_by,
                  created_on,
                  updated_by,
                  updated_on,
							    workspace
             from apex_application_page_ir aa
             where detail_link_target is not null)
select case  when (src not like '%aria-label%'
                   or src is null ) 
             then 'N'

test.test_name: Card Actions should be available
test.query_clob:
with std as (
    select case when months_between (sysdate, pca.last_updated_on) > svt_preferences.get('SVT_CLEANUP_DELAY')
                then case when pca.condition_type = 'Never'
                          then 'NEVERCARDACTIONS'
                          end
                end child_code,
           pca.condition_type,
           pca.application_id,
           pca.page_id,
           pca.region_id,
           pca.region_name,
           pca.label element_name,
           pca.last_updated_by,
           pca.last_updated_on,
           pca.build_option,
	         pca.action_id component_id,
	         pca.workspace
    from apex_appl_page_card_actions pca
	  where pca.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
)
select case when std.child_code is null 
            then 'Y'
            else 'N'
            end pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('%0 (page %1, app %2) should be made available or deleted. It has been unavailable since `%4`',
                          p0 => 'Card Action with Never condition `'||std.element_name||'`',
                          p1 => std.page_id,
                          p2 => std.application_id,
                          p4 => to_char(std.last_updated_on, 'DD-MON-YY')
                        ) 
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('%0 (page %1, app %2) has been unavailable for too long',
                          p0 => 'Card Action with Never condition `'||std.element_name||'`',
                          p1 => std.page_id,
                          p2 => std.application_id,
                          p4 => to_char(std.last_updated_on, 'DD-MON-YY')
                        ) 
            end issue_title,
	   std.child_code,
     std.element_name,
		 std.component_id,
		 null parent_component_id,
		 std.workspace
from std
test.explanation: Region Operations and features (Validations, procedures, charts, card actions, map layers, search sources) should be available or deleted : \* Charts that have had their Server-Side Condition set to "Never" (for whatever reason), should be removed. Including these items/regions just creates unnecessary app bloat.
test.fix: *   Make available or delete

       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('Region `%0` (page %1, app %2) should be available or deleted (%3). It has been unavailable since `%4`',
                          p0 => std.region_name,
                          p1 => std.page_id,
                          p2 => std.application_id,
                          p3 => case when std.child_code = 'NEVERCON'
                                     then 'Never condition'
                                     end,
                          p4 => to_char(std.last_updated_on, 'DD-MON-YY')
												) 
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('Region `%0` (page %1, app %2) should be available',
                          p0 => std.region_name,
                          p1 => std.page_id,
                          p2 => std.application_id) 
            end issue_title,
	   std.child_code,
		 std.component_id,
		 null parent_component_id,
		 std.workspace
from std
test.explanation: Regions that are suppressed (with a Never condition, for eg) should be made available or deleted : Page regions and items that have had their Server-Side Condition set to "Never" (for whatever reason), should be removed. Including these items/regions just creates unnecessary app bloat.
test.fix: Remove the region or make it available

test.test_name: Map Layers should be available
test.query_clob:
with std as (
    select case when months_between (sysdate, pml.last_updated_on) > svt_preferences.get('SVT_CLEANUP_DELAY')
                then case when pml.condition_type = 'Never'
                          then 'NEVERMAPLAYERS'
                          end
                end child_code,
           pml.condition_type,
           pml.application_id,
           pml.page_id,
           pml.region_id,
           pml.region_name,
           pml.name element_name,
           pml.last_updated_by,
           pml.last_updated_on,
           pml.build_option,
	         pml.layer_id component_id,
	         pml.workspace
    from apex_appl_page_map_layers pml
	  where pml.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
)
select case when std.child_code is null 
            then 'Y'
            else 'N'
            end pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('%0 (page %1, app %2) should be made available or deleted. It has been unavailable since `%4`',
                          p0 => 'Map Layer with Never condition `'||std.element_name||'`',
                          p1 => std.page_id,
                          p2 => std.application_id,
                          p4 => to_char(std.last_updated_on, 'DD-MON-YY')
                        ) 
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('%0 (page %1, app %2) has been unavailable for too long',
                          p0 =>'Map Layer with Never condition `'||std.element_name||'`',
                          p1 => std.page_id,
                          p2 => std.application_id,
                          p4 => to_char(std.last_updated_on, 'DD-MON-YY')
                        ) 
            end issue_title,
	   std.child_code,
     std.element_name,
		 std.component_id,
		 null parent_component_id,
		 std.workspace
from std
test.explanation: Region Operations and features (Validations, procedures, charts, card actions, map layers, search sources) should be available or deleted : \* Charts that have had their Server-Side Condition set to "Never" (for whatever reason), should be removed. Including these items/regions just creates unnecessary app bloat.
test.fix: *   Make available or delete

test.test_name: Do not use console.log
test.query_clob:
select case when lower(aapda.attribute_01) like '%console.log%'
            then 'N'
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,
       aapda.workspace,
       aapda.application_id, 
       aapda.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapda.last_updated_by,
       aapda.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Dynamic Action Action `%0` (app %1, page %2) uses console.log: `%3...`', 
        p0 => aapda.dynamic_action_name, 
        p1 => aapda.application_id,
        p2 => aapda.page_id,
        p3 => substr(aapda.attribute_01,1,50)) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Dynamic Action Action `%0` uses console.log (app %1, page %2, action id %3)', 
        p0 => aapda.dynamic_action_name, 
        p1 => aapda.application_id,
        p2 => aapda.page_id,
				p3 => aapda.action_id) issue_title,
       aapda.action_id component_id,
       aapda.dynamic_action_id parent_component_id,
       aapda.dynamic_action_name,
       aapda.attribute_01 javascript_code
from apex_application_page_da_acts aapda
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapda.page_id
                                      and aap.application_id = aapda.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on  aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on  aabo2.build_option_name = aapda.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapda.application_id
where aapda.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and aapda.action_code = 'NATIVE_JAVASCRIPT_CODE'
test.explanation: Console.log is spammy because it always logs

test.test_name: Form Elements may benefit from help text
test.query_clob:
with pproc as (select application_id, page_id, count(1) proc_count
                from apex_application_page_proc
                group by application_id, page_id),
     api as (select case when lower(api.label) in ('username','password')
                         then 'Y'
						             when api.item_help_text is null 
                         then case when api.display_as = 'Checkbox' 
                                   and api.item_label_template in ('Label Top')
                                   then 'Y'
                                   else 'N'
                                   end
                         else 'Y'
                         end pass_yn,
                    api.application_id,
                    api.page_id,
                    api.last_updated_by,
                    api.last_updated_on,
                    api.item_id component_id,
                    api.item_name,
                    api.item_source_type,
                    api.item_help_text,
                    api.display_as,
                    aap.build_option,
                    abo.build_option_status,
                    abo.status_on_export,
                    api.item_label_template,
                    api.label,
                    api.workspace,
                    pproc.proc_count
            from apex_application_page_items api
            inner join apex_application_pages aap on  api.application_id = aap.application_id
                                                  and api.page_id = aap.page_id
            inner join pproc on  pproc.application_id = api.application_id
                             and pproc.page_id = api.page_id
            left outer join apex_application_build_options abo on  aap.application_id = abo.application_id
                                                               and aap.build_option = abo.build_option_name 
            left outer join apex_application_build_options abo2 on  api.application_id = abo2.application_id
                                                                and api.build_option = abo2.build_option_name 
            where api.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
            and api.display_as not in ('Hidden')
            and coalesce(abo.status_on_export,'NA') not in ('Exclude')
            and coalesce(abo2.status_on_export,'NA') not in ('Exclude')
            )
select api.pass_yn,
       api.application_id,
       api.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       api.last_updated_by,
       api.last_updated_on,
       case when api.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format('Item `%0` (page %1, app %2, displayed as `%3`) is missing Help Text. Form items require Help Text.',
                          p0 => api.item_name,
                          p1 => api.page_id,
                          p2 => api.application_id,
                          p3 => api.display_as) 
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when api.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format('Item `%0` (page %1, app %2) is missing Help Text',
                          p0 => api.item_name,
                          p1 => api.page_id,
                          p2 => api.application_id) 
            end issue_title,
       api.component_id,
       api.item_name,
       api.display_as,
       null parent_component_id,
       api.item_help_text,
       api.item_source_type,
       api.item_label_template,
       api.label,
       api.workspace,
       api.proc_count
from api
test.explanation:
All editable form elements should have help text. This test is tied to the following WCAG Codes :

1.  3.3.2(A) : Labels or Instructions:  
    Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input.
    
2.  1.3.5(AA) : Identify Input Purpose:
    
    The purpose of each input field collecting information about the user can be programmatically determined when:
    
    The input field serves a purpose identified in the Input Purposes for User Interface Components section; and  
    The content is implemented using technologies with support for identifying the expected meaning for form input data.
    
3.  3.3.5(AAA) : Help : Context-sensitive help is available.
test.fix: Add Help Text

test.test_name: Scratch Pages have 'dev_only' builds on them
test.query_clob:
select 'N' pass_yn,
       aap.workspace,
       aap.application_id, 
       aap.page_id,
       aap.created_by,
       aap.created_on,
       aap.last_updated_by,
       aap.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) should have a build that excludes it on export', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) should have a `DEV_ONLY` build', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) issue_title,
       aap.page_id component_id,
       aap.application_id parent_component_id,
       aap.page_name,
       aap.page_mode
from apex_application_pages aap
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on  aabo2.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aap.application_id
where aap.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'

     or lower(aap.page_name) like '%sandbox%'

test.fix: Add the build option.

test.test_name: Time formats should be set in Globalization Attributes
test.query_clob:
select case when date_format = '&AI_FMT_DATE.'
          and date_time_format = '&AI_FMT_DATETIME.'
          and timestamp_format = '&AI_FMT_TIMESTAMP.'
          and timestamp_tz_format = '&AI_FMT_TIMESTAMP_TZ.'
          then 'Y'
          else 'N'
          end pass_yn,
       aa.workspace,
       aa.application_id, 
       null page_id,
       aa.created_by,
       aa.created_on,
       aa.last_updated_by,
       aa.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Application `%0` (app %1) has incorrect time formats set [`%2`, `%3`, `%4`, `%5`]', 
        p0 => aa.application_name, 
        p1 => aa.application_id,
				p2 => date_format, 
			  p3 => date_time_format, 
			  p4 => timestamp_format, 
			  p5 => timestamp_tz_format) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Application `%0` (app %1) has incorrect time formats set', 
        p0 => aa.application_name, 
        p1 => aa.application_id) issue_title,
       aa.application_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aa.application_name,
       aa.alias,
       aa.availability_status,
			 date_format, 
			 date_time_format, 
			 timestamp_format, 
			 timestamp_tz_format
from apex_applications aa
inner join v_svt_stds_applications esa on aa.application_id = esa.apex_app_id
                                       and esa.type_code not in ('DEVUTIL')
where aa.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
test.explanation: It's important to standardize how we handle date time values
test.fix:
Go to Application Definition > Globalization and set the followin values

1.  Application Date Dormat should be '&AI\_FMT\_DATE.'
2.  Application Date Time Format should be '&AI\_FMT\_DATETIME.'
3.  Application Timestamp Format should be '&AI\_FMT\_TIMESTAMP.'
4.  Application Timestamp Timezone Format should be '&AI\_FMT\_TIMESTAMP\_TZ.'

test.test_name: Classic Columns are correctly aligned
test.query_clob:
with std as (select case when prc.heading_alignment != prc.column_alignment
                         then 'MISALIGN_C'
                         end child_code,
            prc.application_id, 
            prc.page_id, 
            prc.column_alias, 
            prc.heading, 
            prc.heading_alignment,
            prc.column_alignment,
            prc.display_as,
            null column_type,
            prc.region_id,
            prc.region_name,
            prc.region_report_column_id component_id,
            prc.last_updated_by,
            prc.last_updated_on,
            null created_on,
            null created_by,
						workspace
            from apex_application_page_rpt_cols prc
        )
select case when std.child_code is null 
            then 'Y'
            else 'N'
            end pass_yn, 
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Column `%0` in `%1` (page %2, app %3) %4', 
                            p0 => std.heading, 
                            p1 => std.region_name, 
                            p2 => std.page_id, 
                            p3 => std.application_id,
                            p4 => case when std.child_code  = 'LEFT_ALIGN_C'
                                       then 'should be aligned to the left'
                                       when std.child_code  = 'RIGHT_ALIGN_C'
                                       then 'should be aligned to the right'
                                       when std.child_code  = 'MISALIGN_C'
                                       then 'is misaligned with the heading'
                                       end
                            ) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Column `%0` in `%1` (page %2, app %3) is incorrectly aligned', 
                            p0 => std.heading, 
                            p1 => std.region_name, 
                            p2 => std.page_id, 
                            p3 => std.application_id) issue_title,
       std.child_code,
       std.region_id,
       std.component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
			 std.workspace
from std
inner join apex_application_page_regions apr on std.application_id = apr.application_id 
                                             and std.page_id = apr.page_id
                                             and std.region_id = apr.region_id
                                             and coalesce(apr.report_template,'NA') != 'List Item'
where std.heading is not null
and std.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
test.explanation:
Classic Report Columns should be aligned according to their data type :

*   LEFT\_ALIGN\_C : Dates, names, identifier columns should be left aligned
*   MISALIGN\_C : The Column and Column Heading have different alignment
*   RIGHT\_ALIGN\_C : Number columns should be right aligned
test.fix:
*   The Column and Heading should be aligned the same way:
    *   Left Align: All columns by default (dates, names, identifiers, etc)
    *   Center Align: Buttons / Actions / Icons / Badges
    *   Right Align: Number columns that represent size (e.g. budget / counts / etc)
    *   RIGHT\_ALIGN\_C : \* Right Align: Number columns that represent size (e.g. budget / counts / etc)

test.test_name: Form field label is appropriate
test.query_clob:
with std as (
    select case when api.label like '%YN'
                then 'FORMYESNO'
	              when api.label||' ' <> replace(api.label||' ','Id ', 'ID ')
                then 'FORMCAPID'
                end child_code,
                    api.application_id,
                    api.page_id,
                    api.last_updated_by,
                    api.last_updated_on,
                    api.item_id component_id,
                    api.item_name,
                    api.item_source_type,
                    api.item_help_text,
                    api.display_as,
                    api.label,
                    null created_by,
                    null created_on,
										null parent_component_id,
	                  api.workspace
            from apex_application_page_items api
            where api.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
	          and api.display_as not in ('Hidden')
)
select case when std.child_code is null 
            then 'Y' 
            else 'N'
            end pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('Form field `%0` (page %2, app %3) %4',
                          p0 => std.label,
                          p2 => std.page_id,
                          p3 => std.application_id,
                          p4 => case when std.child_code ='FORMYESNO'
							  										then 'should not include `YN`'
							  										when std.child_code ='FORMCAPID'
							  										then 'has incorrect capitalization for `ID`'
                                    end
                          ) 
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('Form field `%0` is incorrectly formatted (page %2, app %3, item id %4)',
                          p0 => std.label,
                          p2 => std.page_id,
                          p3 => std.application_id,
													p4 => std.component_id
                          ) 
            end issue_title,
	   std.child_code,
		 std.component_id,
		 std.parent_component_id,
		 std.workspace
from std
test.explanation:
Form field labels should be meaningful, formatted and punctuation free :

*   FORMCAPID : Ensure the letters I and D are both capitalized in label like "Service ID, Resource ID, Region ID, etc..." These are incorrect: Service Id, service id, etc...
*   FORMYESNO : Never include YN as part of the label
test.fix:
*   FORMCAPID : Correct the capitalization
*   FORMYESNO : correct the label

test.test_name: Application Item incorrectly prefixed
test.query_clob:
select a3.pass_yn,
       a3.application_id,
			 null page_id,
			 null child_code,
       a3.application_item_id,
       a3.application_name, 
       a3.item_name, 
       a3.scope,
       a3.created_by,
       a3.created_on, 
       a3.last_updated_by, 
       a3.last_updated_on,
       case when a3.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => q'^%1, %2 application item (id: %0), should begin with 'G_' and 'A_'^',
                                    p0 => a3.application_item_id,
                                    p1 => a3.item_name, 
                                    p2 => a3.scope)
            end as validation_failure_message,
       case when a3.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => q'^%0 in app %1 is incorrectly named^',
                                    p0 => a3.item_name,
                                    p1 => a3.application_id
                                    )
            end as issue_title,
			a3.component_id,
	    a3.parent_component_id,
			a3.workspace
from (
     select 
     case when ai.item_name like 'G_%' or ai.item_name like 'A_%'
          then 'Y'
          else 'N'
          end as pass_yn,
     ai.application_id,
     ai.application_item_id,
     ai.application_name, 
     ai.item_name, 
     ai.scope,
     aa.created_by,
     aa.created_on,
     ai.last_updated_by, 
     ai.last_updated_on,
	   ai.application_item_id component_id,
	   null parent_component_id,
	   ai.workspace
     from apex_application_items ai
     inner join v_svt_apex_applications aa on ai.application_id = aa.application_id
                                    and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
) a3

test.test_name: SVT Application Pages should have Authorization Schemes
test.query_clob:
with origin_auth as (select 
                         spu.destination_app_id, spu.destination_page_id
                         , listagg(distinct spu.element_authorization       ,'/' on overflow truncate with count) within group (order by spu.element_authorization) origin_element_authorization
                         , listagg(distinct spu.parent_element_authorization,'/' on overflow truncate with count) within group (order by spu.parent_element_authorization) origin_parent_element_authorization
                         , listagg(distinct spu.page_authorization          ,'/' on overflow truncate with count) within group (order by spu.page_authorization) origin_page_authorization
                         from v_mv_svt spu
                         where spu.destination_app_id is not null
                         and spu.destination_page_id is not null
                         and spu.url_type not in ('BC_URL') --breadcrumbs cause a lot of complexity in this context
                         group by spu.destination_app_id, spu.destination_page_id
                    ),
     a40 as (
          select 
          case when aap.page_requires_authentication = 'Yes'
               and aap.authorization_scheme is null
               then 'N'
			 				 when aap.authorization_scheme = 'APPLICATION SENTRY'
			 				 then 'N'
               else 'Y'
               end as pass_yn, 
          aap.application_id,
          aap.page_id, 
          aap.page_name, 
          aap.page_access_protection, 
          aap.page_mode,
          aap.page_requires_authentication,
          apex_string.format('%0:%1:%2:%3', oa.origin_element_authorization,oa.origin_parent_element_authorization, oa.origin_page_authorization, aa.authorization_scheme) origin_authorizations,
          aap.build_option,
          bo.build_option_status,
			    bo.status_on_export,
          oa.origin_element_authorization,
          oa.origin_parent_element_authorization origin_parent_elemnt_authztn, 
          oa.origin_page_authorization, 
          aa.authorization_scheme app_authorization_scheme,
          aap.created_by, 
          aap.created_on, 
          aap.last_updated_by, 
          aap.last_updated_on,
			    aap.workspace
          from apex_application_pages aap
          inner join apex_applications aa on aap.application_id = aa.application_id
                                          and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
          left join apex_application_build_options bo on aap.application_id = bo.application_id
                                                  and aap.build_option = bo.build_option_name
          left join origin_auth oa on oa.destination_app_id = aap.application_id
                                   and oa.destination_page_id = aap.page_id
          where aap.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
			    and aap.page_id != 0
          and (bo.status_on_export != 'Exclude' or bo.build_option_status is null)
     )
select a40.pass_yn, 
       a40.application_id,
       a40.page_id, 
       a40.page_name, 
       a40.page_access_protection, 
       a40.page_mode,
       a40.page_requires_authentication,
       a40.origin_authorizations,
       a40.build_option,
       a40.build_option_status,
       a40.origin_element_authorization,
       a40.origin_parent_elemnt_authztn, 
       a40.origin_page_authorization, 
       a40.app_authorization_scheme,
       a40.created_by, 
       a40.created_on, 
       a40.last_updated_by, 
       a40.last_updated_on,
       case when a40.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => 
            q'^Page %10 is missing an authorization scheme. 
            • Page Access Protection: %0
            • Page Mode: %1
            • Page Requires Authentication: %2
            • Origin Authorizations: %3 
            %4 
            %5^',
            p0 => a40.page_access_protection, 
            p1 => a40.page_mode,
            p2 => a40.page_requires_authentication,
            p3 => a40.origin_authorizations,
            p4 => case when a40.build_option is not null
                       then '• Build Option: '||a40.build_option
                       end,
            p5 => case when a40.build_option_status is not null
                       then '• Build status: '||a40.build_option_status
                       end,
            p6 => a40.origin_element_authorization,
            p7 => a40.origin_parent_elemnt_authztn, 
            p8 => a40.origin_page_authorization, 
            p9 => a40.app_authorization_scheme,
            p10 => a40.page_id
            )
            end as validation_failure_message,
       case when a40.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => 
            q'^SVT Page %0 (app %1) is missing an authorization scheme^',
            p0 => a40.page_id, 
            p1 => a40.application_id
            )
            end as issue_title,
			 a40.page_id component_id,
			 null parent_component_id,
			 a40.workspace
from a40
where a40.application_id = 17000033
test.explanation: SVT Application pages should have authorization schemes for consistency and security
test.fix:
Select an authorization scheme applied to the page. Authorization schemes are defined at the application-level and can be applied to many elements within the application.

An authorization scheme is evaluated either once for each application session (at session creation), or once for each page view. If the selected authorization scheme evaluates to **TRUE**, then the page displays and is subject to other defined conditions. If it evaluates to **FALSE**, then the page does not display and an error message displays.

test.test_name: Breadcrumb hierarchy should match nav menu
test.query_clob:
with bce as (select application_id, element_label, element_id, parent_element_name, 
                opt_parent_element_id, destination_app_id, destination_page_id, parent_element_id, last_updated_by, last_updated_on, workspace
                from mv_svt_bc_entries),
    bcep as (select application_id, element_label, element_id, destination_app_id, destination_page_id, parent_element_id, workspace
                from mv_svt_bc_entries),
    nle as (select spu.application_id, spu.element_id, spu.parent_element_id, spu.parent_element_name, spu.destination_page_id, spu.opt_parent_element_id, spu.workspace
            from mv_svt_list_entries spu
            inner join apex_applications aa on spu.application_id = aa.application_id
                                            and spu.parent_element_name = aa.navigation_list),
    nlep as (select spu.application_id, spu.element_id, spu.parent_element_id, spu.parent_element_name, spu.destination_page_id, spu.opt_parent_element_id, spu.workspace
            from mv_svt_list_entries spu
            inner join apex_applications aa on spu.application_id = aa.application_id
                                            and spu.parent_element_name = aa.navigation_list),
    std as (select  bce.application_id, 
                    bce.element_label, 
                    bce.parent_element_name,
                    bce.destination_page_id bc_target_page_id,
                    bcep.destination_page_id bc_parent_target_page_id,
                    nle.destination_page_id le_target_page_id,
                    nlep.destination_page_id le_parent_target_page_id,
                    bce.element_id component_id,
                    bce.parent_element_id parent_component_id,
                    bce.last_updated_by, 
                    bce.last_updated_on,
                    bce.workspace
                    from bce
                    inner join bcep on bce.opt_parent_element_id = bcep.element_id
                                    and bce.parent_element_id = bcep.parent_element_id
                                    and bce.application_id = bcep.application_id
                    left outer join nle on nle.application_id = bce.application_id
                                        and nle.destination_page_id = bce.destination_page_id
                    left outer join nlep on nlep.application_id = bce.application_id
                                        and nlep.element_id = nle.opt_parent_element_id
                    where bce.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
            )
select case when aap.page_template like 'AO%'
            then 'Y'
            when std.bc_parent_target_page_id = std.le_parent_target_page_id
            then 'Y'
            else 'N'
            end pass_yn, 
       std.application_id, 
       null page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format (
            'The parent breadcrumb entry of `%0` (app %1, page %2) targets page %3. %4',
            p0 =>  std.element_label,
            p1 => std.application_id,
            p2 => std.bc_target_page_id,
            p3 => std.bc_parent_target_page_id,
            p4 => case when std.le_target_page_id is null 
                       then 'There is no corresponding nav menu entry'
                       else case when std.le_parent_target_page_id is null 
                                then 'The corresponding nav list entry has no parent'
                                else 'The parent nav list entry for the same page targets page '||std.le_parent_target_page_id
                                end
                       end
       ) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format (
            'The parent breadcrumb entry of `%0` (app %1, page %2) does not match the nav menu entry',
            p0 =>  std.element_label,
            p1 => std.application_id,
            p2 => std.bc_target_page_id
       ) issue_title,
       std.component_id, 
       std.parent_component_id,
       std.element_label, 
       std.parent_element_name,
       std.bc_target_page_id,
       std.bc_parent_target_page_id,
       std.le_target_page_id,
       std.le_parent_target_page_id,
       aap.page_template,
			 std.workspace
from std
inner join apex_application_pages aap on  aap.application_id = std.application_id
                                      and aap.page_id = std.bc_target_page_id
																			and aap.page_template not like 'AO%'
inner join apex_application_pages aap2 on  aap2.application_id = std.application_id
                                       and aap2.page_id = std.bc_parent_target_page_id
                                       and aap2.page_template not like 'AO%'
test.explanation: Breadcrumb hierarchies should match navigation menu hierarchies
test.fix: Correct the hierarchies

            end pass_yn,

test.test_name: Apps should have particular set of builds
test.query_clob:
with std as (
    select aa.application_id,
       0 page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       coalesce (td.last_updated_by, do.last_updated_by) last_updated_by,
       coalesce (td.last_updated_on, do.last_updated_on) last_updated_on,
       case when td.build_option_name is null 
            then 'TO_DELETE_MISSING'
            when do.build_option_name is null
            then 'DEV_ONLY_MISSING'
            else coalesce(td.child_code,do.child_code)
            end child_code, 
       do.build_option_status do_build_option_status, 
       do.status_on_export    do_status_on_export,
       td.build_option_status td_build_option_status, 
       td.status_on_export    td_status_on_export,
	     aa.workspace
    from apex_applications aa
    left join (select 
                  case when build_option_status != 'Include'
                       then 'DEV_ONLY_EXCLUDED'
                       when status_on_export != 'Exclude'
                       then 'DEV_ONLY_INCLUDED'
                       end child_code,
                  application_id, 
                  build_option_name, 
                  build_option_status, 
                  status_on_export,
                  last_updated_by,
                  last_updated_on
            from apex_application_build_options
            where build_option_name = 'DEV_ONLY') do on aa.application_id = do.application_id
    left join (select 
                  case when build_option_status = 'Include' or status_on_export = 'Include'
                       then 'TO_DELETE_INCLUDED'
                       end child_code,
                  application_id, 
                  build_option_name, 
                  build_option_status, 
                  status_on_export,
                  last_updated_by,
                  last_updated_on
            from apex_application_build_options
            where build_option_name = 'TO_DELETE') td on aa.application_id = td.application_id
    where aa.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
)
select case when std.child_code is not null
            then 'N'
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.child_code is not null
            then apex_string.format('Application %0 %1',
                                    p0 => std.application_id,
                                    p1 => case when std.child_code = 'TO_DELETE_MISSING'
                                               then 'is missing a `TO_DELETE` build option'
                                               when std.child_code = 'DEV_ONLY_MISSING'
                                               then 'is missing a `DEV_ONLY` build option'
                                               when std.child_code = 'DEV_ONLY_EXCLUDED'
                                               then 'has a misconfigured DEV_ONLY build - it has a build option status set to `Excluded`'
                                               when std.child_code = 'DEV_ONLY_INCLUDED'
                                               then 'has a misconfigured DEV_ONLY build - it has a status on export set to `included`'
                                               when std.child_code = 'TO_DELETE_INCLUDED'
                                               then 'has a misconfigured TO_DELETE build - at least one of the statuses is set to `included`'
                                               end
                                    )
            end  validation_failure_message,
       case when std.child_code is not null
            then apex_string.format('Application %0 %1 (TO_DELETE status = %2, export = %3) (DEV_ONLY status = %4, export = %5)',
                                    p0 => std.application_id,
                                    p1 => case when std.child_code = 'TO_DELETE_MISSING'
                                               then 'is missing a `TO_DELETE` build option'
                                               when std.child_code = 'DEV_ONLY_MISSING'
                                               then 'is missing a `DEV_ONLY` build option'
                                               when std.child_code = 'DEV_ONLY_EXCLUDED'
                                               then 'has a misconfigured DEV_ONLY build - it has a build option status set to `Excluded`'
                                               when std.child_code = 'DEV_ONLY_INCLUDED'
                                               then 'has a misconfigured DEV_ONLY build - it has a status on export set to `included`'
                                               when std.child_code = 'TO_DELETE_INCLUDED'
                                               then 'has a misconfigured TO_DELETE build - at least one of the statuses is set to `included`'
                                               end,
                                    p2 => coalesce(std.td_build_option_status, 'NA'),
                                    p3 => coalesce(std.td_status_on_export, 'NA'),
                                    p4 => coalesce(std.do_build_option_status, 'NA'),
                                    p5 => coalesce(std.do_status_on_export, 'NA')
                                    )
            end issue_title,
	     std.child_code,
       std.do_build_option_status,
       std.do_status_on_export,
       std.td_build_option_status,
       std.td_status_on_export,
			 std.application_id component_id,
	     null parent_component_id,
			 std.workspace
from std
test.explanation:
Apps should have 'dev\_only' and 'to\_delete' builds :

*   DEV\_ONLY\_EXCLUDED : The \`DEV\_ONLY\` build option, as the name suggests should be \`included\` in the dev environment
*   DEV\_ONLY\_INCLUDED : The \`DEV\_ONLY\` build has been misconfigured to include the underlying on objects on export. It should be set to exclude on export.
*   DEV\_ONLY\_MISSING : Apps should have a \`DEV\_ONLY\` build which, as the name suggests, includes the underlying objects in the dev environment, but excludes it on export. This build option is used to flag components that are not ready for deployment
*   TO\_DELETE\_INCLUDED : The \`TO\_DELETE\` build has been misconfigured to include the underlying on objects. It should be set to exclude.
*   TO\_DELETE\_MISSING : Apps should have a \`TO\_DELETE\` build that excludes the underlying objects both in the dev environment and on export. This allows us to flag components that candidates for deletion without having to immediately delete them.
test.fix: Correct the build option

test.test_name: IR Column header is appropriate
test.query_clob:
with std as (
    select case when regexp_instr (translate(pic.report_label,'()-',' '), '[[:punct:]]') > 0
                then 'NOPUNCTUATION_IR'
                when upper(pic.report_label) like '%YN'
                then 'YESNO_IR'
                when pic.report_label||' ' <> replace(pic.report_label||' ','Id ', 'ID ')
                then 'CAPID_IR'
                end child_code,
           pic.application_id, 
           pic.page_id, 
           pic.column_alias, 
           pic.report_label, 
           pic.region_name,
           pic.region_id,
           pic.column_id component_id,
           pic.created_by,
           pic.created_on,
           pic.updated_by last_updated_by,
           pic.updated_on last_updated_on,
           pic.display_text_as,
           pic.workspace
    from apex_application_page_ir_col pic
    where pic.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE') 
    and pic.display_text_as not in ('HIDDEN','HIDDEN_ESCAPE_SC')
)
select case when std.child_code is null 
            then 'Y' 
            else 'N'
            end pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('Column `%0` (IR `%1`, page %2, app %3) %4',
                          p0 => std.report_label,
                          p1 => std.region_name,
                          p2 => std.page_id,
                          p3 => std.application_id,
                          p4 => case when std.child_code = 'NOPUNCTUATION_IR'
                                     then 'should not include punctuation'
																		 when std.child_code ='YESNO_IR'
																		 then 'should not include `YN`'
																		 when std.child_code ='CAPID_IR'
																		 then 'has incorrect capitalization for `ID`'
                                     end
                          ) 
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('Column `%0` is incorrectly formatted (IR `%1`, page %2, app %3, col id %4) ',
                          p0 => std.report_label,
                          p1 => std.region_name,
                          p2 => std.page_id,
                          p3 => std.application_id,
                          p4 => std.component_id
                          ) 
            end issue_title,
     std.child_code,
     std.component_id,
     null parent_component_id,
     std.workspace
from std
test.explanation:
Interactive Report Column headers should be meaningful, formatted and punctuation free :

*   CAPID\_IR : Ensure the letters I and D are both capitalized in Column Headers like "Service ID, Resource ID, Region ID, etc..." These are incorrect: Service Id, service id, etc...
*   NOPUNCTUATION\_IR : Column Headers should not include punctuation
*   YESNO\_IR : Never include YN as part of the column header's title
test.fix:
*   CAPID\_IR : Correct the capitalization
*   NOPUNCTUATION\_IR : Remove the punctuation
*   YESNO\_IR : Rename column heading

               aa.created_by,

               aa.css_file_urls,
               aac.page_count,
               acss.file_count,
			         aac.workspace,
               case when aac.page_count = 0
                    then 'Y' 
                    else case when coalesce(acss.file_count,0) = 0
                              then 'MISSING_CSS_FILE'
                              else case when aa.css_file_urls is null 
                                        then 'MISSING_CSS_REFERENCE'
                                        end
                              end 
                    end child_code
        from aac 
        inner join apex_applications aa on aac.application_id = aa.application_id
        left outer join acss on acss.application_id = aac.application_id
     )
select case when std.child_code is not null
            then 'N'
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.child_code is not null
            then apex_string.format('App %0 %1',
                    p0 => std.application_id,
                    p1 => case when std.child_code = 'MISSING_CSS_FILE'
                               then 'is missing a CSS file in Static Application Files (suggestion: `css/main.css`)'
                               when std.child_code = 'MISSING_CSS_REFERENCE'
                               then 'does not reference a centralized css file in Application Definition > User Interfaces > CSS File URLs'
                               end
                ) 
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.child_code is not null
            then apex_string.format('App %0 %1',
                    p0 => std.application_id,
                    p1 => case when std.child_code = 'MISSING_CSS_FILE'
                               then 'is missing a centralized CSS file'
                               when std.child_code = 'MISSING_CSS_REFERENCE'
                               then 'does not reference a centralized css file'
                               end
                ) 
            end  issue_title,
	   std.child_code,
     std.css_file_urls,
     std.page_count,
     std.file_count,
		 std.application_id component_id,
     null parent_component_id,
		 std.workspace
from std
test.explanation: Apps with page-level inline css should have a css file in static files

test.test_name: Item Overview Content is correctly configured

test.test_name: IG Columns are correctly aligned
test.query_clob:
with std as (select case when pig.data_type in ('DATE', 'VARCHAR2')
                        then case when pig.heading_alignment = 'RIGHT'
                                  then 'LEFT_ALIGN_IG'
                                  end
                        when pig.data_type in ('NUMBER')
                        then case when pig.heading_alignment = 'LEFT'
                                  then 'RIGHT_ALIGN_IG'
                                  end
                        end child_code,
            pig.application_id, 
            pig.page_id, 
            pig.source_expression column_alias, 
            pig.heading, 
            pig.heading_alignment,
            null column_alignment,
            pig.item_type display_as,
            pig.data_type column_type,
            pig.region_id,
            pig.region_name,
            pig.column_id component_id,
            pig.last_updated_by,
            pig.last_updated_on,
            null created_on,
            null created_by,
						pig.workspace
        from  apex_appl_page_ig_columns pig
				where pig.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
        )
select case when std.child_code is null 
            then 'Y'
            else 'N'
            end pass_yn, 
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Column `%0` in `%1` (page %2, app %3) %4', 
                            p0 => std.heading, 
                            p1 => std.region_name, 
                            p2 => std.page_id, 
                            p3 => std.application_id,
                            p4 => case when std.child_code  = 'LEFT_ALIGN_IG'
                                       then 'should be aligned to the left'
                                       when std.child_code  = 'RIGHT_ALIGN_IG'
                                       then 'should be aligned to the right'
                                       when std.child_code  = 'MISALIGN_IG'
                                       then 'is misaligned with the heading'
                                       end
                            ) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Column `%0` in `%1` (page %2, app %3) is incorrectly aligned', 
                            p0 => std.heading, 
                            p1 => std.region_name, 
                            p2 => std.page_id, 
                            p3 => std.application_id) issue_title,
       std.child_code,
       std.region_id,
       std.component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
			 std.workspace
from std
inner join apex_application_page_regions apr on std.application_id = apr.application_id 
                                             and std.page_id = apr.page_id
                                             and std.region_id = apr.region_id
                                             and coalesce(apr.report_template,'NA') != 'List Item'
where std.heading is not null
test.explanation:
Interactive Grid Columns should be aligned according to their data type :

*   LEFT\_ALIGN\_IG : Dates, names, identifier columns should be left aligned
*   MISALIGN\_IG : The Column and Column Heading have different alignment
*   RIGHT\_ALIGN\_IG : Number columns should be right aligned
test.fix:
*   The Column and Heading should be aligned the same way:
    *   Left Align: All columns by default (dates, names, identifiers, etc)
    *   Center Align: Buttons / Actions / Icons / Badges
    *   Right Align: Number columns that represent size (e.g. budget / counts / etc)
    *   RIGHT\_ALIGN\_IG : \* Right Align: Number columns that represent size (e.g. budget / counts / etc)

test.test_name: List Entries should use the correct icons
test.query_clob:
with std as (select case when aale.entry_image like 'fa%'
                         then 'N'
                         else 'Y'
                         end pass_yn,
                    aale.application_id, 
                    null page_id,
                    null created_by,
                    null created_on,
                    aale.last_updated_by,
                    aale.last_updated_on,
                    aale.list_entry_id component_id,
                    aale.list_entry_parent_id parent_component_id,
                    aale.entry_image,
                    aale.entry_text,
						        aale.workspace
               from apex_application_list_entries aale
               inner join apex_applications aa on aale.application_id = aa.application_id
                                             and aa.theme_number = 1000
               left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aale.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aale.application_id
               where aale.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
               and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude')
select std.pass_yn,
       std.application_id, 
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       std.component_id,
       std.parent_component_id,
       std.entry_image,
       case when std.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format('List entry `%0` (app %1) uses a Univeral Theme icon (`%2`). You must use a Redwood icon.',
                    p0 => std.entry_text,
                    p1 => std.application_id,
                    p2 => std.entry_image
                    )
            end  validation_failure_message,
       case when std.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format('List entry `%0` (app %1) uses an invalid icon',
                    p0 => std.entry_text,
                    p1 => std.application_id
                    )
            end  issue_title, 
       std.entry_text,
			 std.workspace
from std
test.explanation: List entries must not use a Universal theme icon in the `entry_image` field
test.fix: Replace the icon with a Redwood icon. You can look them up [here](r/redwood/redwood-sample-application/icon-browser "redwood icons").

test.test_name: IR Columns are correctly aligned

select case when lower(aapda.attribute_01) like '%.removeclass%'
            then 'N'
            when lower(aapda.attribute_01) like '%.addclass%'
            then 'N'
            when lower(aapda.attribute_01) like '%.text%'

       aapda.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Dynamic Action Action `%0` (app %1, page %2) manipulates the DOM: `%3...`', 
        p0 => aapda.dynamic_action_name, 
        p1 => aapda.application_id,
        p2 => aapda.page_id,
        p3 => substr(aapda.attribute_01,1,50)) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Dynamic Action Action `%0` manipulates the DOM (app %1, page %2, action id %3)', 
        p0 => aapda.dynamic_action_name, 
        p1 => aapda.application_id,
        p2 => aapda.page_id,
