test.test_name: Pages should limit the amount of Dynamic Actions
test.query_clob:
with tmd as (select workspace, application_id, page_id, count(*) da_count
             from apex_application_page_da
						 where workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
             having count(*) > 20
             group by workspace, application_id, page_id)
select 'N'  pass_yn,
       tmd.application_id,
       tmd.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aap.last_updated_by,
       aap.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page %0 (app %1) has %2 dynamic actions. It is not recommended to have more than 10.',
                          tmd.application_id,
                          tmd.page_id,
                          tmd.da_count) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page %0 (app %1) has too many Dynamic Actions',
                          tmd.application_id,
                          tmd.page_id) issue_title,
       tmd.da_count,
			 aap.build_option,
       abo.build_option_status,
       abo.status_on_export,
			 tmd.page_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
			 tmd.workspace
from tmd
inner join apex_application_pages aap on  tmd.application_id = aap.application_id
                                      and tmd.page_id = aap.page_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options abo on abo.application_id = aap.application_id 
                                                   and abo.build_option_name = aap.build_option
where coalesce(abo.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation: Pages should limit the number of Dynamic Actions per page to 10. Never more than 20. : Try to limit the number of Dynamic Actions per page to 10. Never more than 20.
test.fix: Cut down on the number of Dynamic Actions

        p2 => aapr.page_id,
        p3 => aapr.display_position) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Region `%0` (app %1, page %2) is in the wrong display position',

        p1 => aapr.application_id,
        p2 => aapr.page_id) issue_title,

left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id

                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapr.application_id

As of the time of this writing, the 2 region templates that represent these display positions are `Page Header` and `Collection Toolbar`, so consider placing your region in a region of these template types.

test.test_name: Page Items incorrectly prefixed
test.query_clob:
select a50.pass_yn,
       a50.application_id,
			 null child_code,
       a50.page_id, 
       a50.page_name, 
       a50.component_id, 
			 null parent_component_id,
       a50.item_name, 
       a50.region,
       a50.created_by, 
       a50.created_on, 
       a50.last_updated_by, 
       a50.last_updated_on,
			 a50.workspace,
       case when a50.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => 
            q'^%1, is incorrectly named (id: %0, region: %2)^',
            p0 => a50.component_id, 
            p1 => a50.item_name, 
            p2 => a50.region
            )
            end as validation_failure_message,
       case when a50.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => 
            q'^%1 is incorrectly named (page %0 app %2)^',
            p0 => a50.page_id, 
            p1 => a50.item_name, 
            p2 => a50.application_id
            )
            end as issue_title
from (
     select 
     case when pi.item_name like 'P'||pi.page_id||'_%'
          then 'Y'
          else 'N'
          end as pass_yn,
     pi.application_id,
     pi.item_id component_id, 
     pi.item_name, 
     pi.page_id, 
     pi.page_name, 
     pi.region,
     app.created_by created_by, 
     app.created_on created_on, 
     coalesce(pi.last_updated_by, app.last_updated_by) last_updated_by, 
     coalesce(pi.last_updated_on, app.last_updated_on) last_updated_on,
	   pi.workspace
     from apex_application_page_items pi
     inner join apex_application_pages app on  app.page_id = pi.page_id
                                           and app.application_id = pi.application_id
     inner join v_svt_apex_applications aa on pi.application_id = aa.application_id
                                     and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
     where pi.page_id not like '%.%' --indicates a translated app 
) a50
test.explanation: Page Items should be prefixed "P" and the \`page id\`, e.g. "P1\_ITEM".
test.fix: Correct the item name

test.fix:
Either

1.  Provide a Redwood Icon in the Appearance > Icon field
2.  Configure a page load Dynamic Action with a `Redwood - Avatar`  or `Redwood - Badge` action. This Dynamic Action sets the requisite icon, badge or initials for the region

You can look Redwood icons [here](r/redwood/redwood-sample-application/icon-browser "redwood icons").

test.test_name: Application Pages should have Authorization Schemes
test.query_clob:
with origin_auth as (select 
                         spu.destination_app_id, spu.destination_page_id
                         , listagg(distinct spu.element_authorization       ,'/' on overflow truncate with count) within group (order by spu.element_authorization) origin_element_authorization
                         , listagg(distinct spu.parent_element_authorization,'/' on overflow truncate with count) within group (order by spu.parent_element_authorization) origin_parent_element_authorization
                         , listagg(distinct spu.page_authorization          ,'/' on overflow truncate with count) within group (order by spu.page_authorization) origin_page_authorization
                         from v_mv_svt spu
                         where spu.destination_app_id is not null
                         and spu.destination_page_id is not null
                         and spu.url_type not in ('BC_URL') --breadcrumbs cause a lot of complexity in this context
                         group by spu.destination_app_id, spu.destination_page_id
                    ),
     a40 as (
          select 
          case when aap.page_requires_authentication = 'Yes'
               and aap.authorization_scheme is null
               then 'N'
               else 'Y'
               end as pass_yn, 
          aap.application_id,
          aap.page_id, 
          aap.page_name, 
          aap.page_access_protection, 
          aap.page_mode,
          aap.page_requires_authentication,
          apex_string.format('%0:%1:%2:%3', oa.origin_element_authorization,oa.origin_parent_element_authorization, oa.origin_page_authorization, aa.authorization_scheme) origin_authorizations,
          aap.build_option,
          bo.build_option_status,
			    bo.status_on_export,
          oa.origin_element_authorization,
          oa.origin_parent_element_authorization origin_parent_elemnt_authztn, 
          oa.origin_page_authorization, 
          aa.authorization_scheme app_authorization_scheme,
          aap.created_by, 
          aap.created_on, 
          aap.last_updated_by, 
          aap.last_updated_on,
			    aap.workspace
          from apex_application_pages aap
          inner join v_svt_apex_applications aa on aap.application_id = aa.application_id
                                        and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
          left join apex_application_build_options bo on aap.application_id = bo.application_id
                                                  and aap.build_option = bo.build_option_name
          left join origin_auth oa on oa.destination_app_id = aap.application_id
                                   and oa.destination_page_id = aap.page_id
          where aap.page_id != 0
          and (bo.status_on_export != 'Exclude' or bo.build_option_status is null)
     )
select a40.pass_yn, 
       a40.application_id,
			 null child_code,
       a40.page_id, 
       a40.page_name, 
       a40.page_access_protection, 
       a40.page_mode,
       a40.page_requires_authentication,
       a40.origin_authorizations,
       a40.build_option,
       a40.build_option_status,
       a40.origin_element_authorization,
       a40.origin_parent_elemnt_authztn, 
       a40.origin_page_authorization, 
       a40.app_authorization_scheme,
       a40.created_by, 
       a40.created_on, 
       a40.last_updated_by, 
       a40.last_updated_on,
       case when a40.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => 
            q'^Page %10 is missing an authorization scheme. 
            • Page Access Protection: %0
            • Page Mode: %1
            • Page Requires Authentication: %2
            • Origin Authorizations: %3 
            %4 
            %5^',
            p0 => a40.page_access_protection, 
            p1 => a40.page_mode,
            p2 => a40.page_requires_authentication,
            p3 => a40.origin_authorizations,
            p4 => case when a40.build_option is not null
                       then '• Build Option: '||a40.build_option
                       end,
            p5 => case when a40.build_option_status is not null
                       then '• Build status: '||a40.build_option_status
                       end,
            p6 => a40.origin_element_authorization,
            p7 => a40.origin_parent_elemnt_authztn, 
            p8 => a40.origin_page_authorization, 
            p9 => a40.app_authorization_scheme,
            p10 => a40.page_id
            )
            end as validation_failure_message,
       case when a40.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => 
            q'^Page %0 (app %1) is missing an authorization scheme^',
            p0 => a40.page_id, 
            p1 => a40.application_id
            )
            end as issue_title,
			 a40.page_id component_id,
			 null parent_component_id,
			 a40.workspace
from a40
test.explanation: APEX pages should have authorization : Application pages should have authorization schemes
test.fix:
Select an authorization scheme applied to the page. Authorization schemes are defined at the application-level and can be applied to many elements within the application.

An authorization scheme is evaluated either once for each application session (at session creation), or once for each page view. If the selected authorization scheme evaluates to **TRUE**, then the page displays and is subject to other defined conditions. If it evaluates to **FALSE**, then the page does not display and an error message displays.

test.test_name: Application has Authorization Scheme
test.query_clob:
select a1.pass_yn, 
       a1.application_id,  
			 null child_code,
       a1.authorization_scheme,
			 null page_id,
       a1.created_by, 
       a1.created_on, 
       a1.last_updated_by, 
       a1.last_updated_on,
       case when a1.pass_yn = 'N'
            then issue_desc
            end as validation_failure_message,
       case when a1.pass_yn = 'N'
            then issue_desc
            end as issue_title,
			 a1.application_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
			 a1.workspace
from (
    select 
    case when aa.authorization_scheme is null
        then 'N'
        else 'Y'
        end as pass_yn,
    aa.application_id,
    aa.authorization_scheme,
    aa.created_by, 
    aa.created_on, 
    aa.last_updated_by, 
    aa.last_updated_on,
    apex_string.format( p_message => q'^Application %0 is missing an Authorization scheme^',
                        p0        => aa.application_id
    ) issue_desc,
	  aa.workspace
    from v_svt_apex_applications aa
    where aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
) a1
test.explanation:
\[Applications have authorization schemes\]  
Applications should have application-level authorization schemes as a matter of best-practice
test.fix: Specify an authorization scheme for your application. Application authorization schemes are defined for an application for the purpose of controlling access. Setting a required authorization scheme here at the application level will require all pages of the application to pass the defined authorization check.

test.test_name: HTML should be escaped in IG Columns
test.query_clob:
select a20.pass_yn, 
       a20.application_id,
       a20.page_id,
       a20.region_id, 
       a20.region_name,
       a20.report_type,
       a20.column_alias,
       a20.report_label,
       a20.created_by, 
       a20.created_on, 
       a20.last_updated_by, 
       a20.last_updated_on,
       case when a20.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => q'^Region `%1` is escaping HTML for column `%3`/`%4` (Region id : %0, type : %2).^',
                                    p0 => a20.region_id, 
                                    p1 => a20.region_name,
                                    p2 => a20.report_type,
                                    p3 => a20.column_alias,
                                    p4 => a20.report_label
                                    )
            end as validation_failure_message,
       case when a20.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => q'^Region `%1` (app %0, page %2) is escaping HTML for column `%4`^',
                                    p0 => a20.application_id, 
                                    p1 => a20.region_name,
                                    p2 => a20.page_id,
                                    p3 => a20.column_alias,
                                    p4 => a20.report_label
                                    )
            end as issue_title,
       a20.component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
			 a20.workspace
from (
     select 
     case when ic2.escape_on_http_output ='Yes'
          then 'Y'
          when ic2.escape_on_http_output is null
          then 'Y'
          else 'N'
          end as pass_yn, 
     ic2.application_id, 
     ic2.region_id, 
     ic2.page_id,
     ic2.region_name, 
     'IR' report_type,
     ic2.name column_alias,
     ic2.heading report_label,
     app.created_by, 
     app.created_on, 
     coalesce(ic2.last_updated_by, app.last_updated_by) last_updated_by, 
     coalesce(ic2.last_updated_on, app.last_updated_on) last_updated_on,
     ic2.column_id component_id,
	   ic2.workspace
     from apex_appl_page_ig_columns ic2
     inner join apex_application_pages app on  app.page_id = ic2.page_id
                                           and app.application_id = ic2.application_id
     inner join v_svt_apex_applications aa on ic2.application_id = aa.application_id
                                       and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
	   where ic2.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
) a20
test.explanation: IG Report columns should escape HTML : Avoid turning the "Escape special characters" setting off on report columns
test.fix: To prevent Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks, always set this attribute to **On**. If you need to render HTML tags stored in the page item or in the entries of a list of values, you can set this flag to **Off**. In such cases, you should take additional precautions to ensure any user input to such fields are properly escaped when entered and before saving.

test.test_name: HTML should be escaped in IR Columns
test.query_clob:
select a20.pass_yn, 
       a20.application_id,
       a20.page_id,
       a20.region_id, 
       a20.region_name,
       a20.report_type,
       a20.column_alias,
       a20.report_label,
       a20.created_by, 
       a20.created_on, 
       a20.updated_by last_updated_by, 
       a20.updated_on last_updated_on,
       case when a20.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => q'^Region `%1` is escaping HTML for column `%3`/`%4` (Region id : %0, type : %2).^',
                                    p0 => a20.region_id, 
                                    p1 => a20.region_name,
                                    p2 => a20.report_type,
                                    p3 => a20.column_alias,
                                    p4 => a20.report_label
                                    )
            end as validation_failure_message,
       case when a20.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => q'^Region `%1` (app %0, page %2) is escaping HTML for column `%4`^',
                                    p0 => a20.application_id, 
                                    p1 => a20.region_name,
                                    p2 => a20.page_id,
                                    p3 => a20.column_alias,
                                    p4 => a20.report_label
                                    )
            end as issue_title,
       a20.component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
			 a20.workspace
from (
     select 
     case when ic1.display_text_as = 'WITHOUT_MODIFICATION'
          then case when ic1.format_mask like 'PCT_GRAPH%' --the percent graph column type does not escape apparently
                    then 'Y'
                    else 'N'
                    end
          else 'Y'
          end as pass_yn,
     ic1.application_id,
     ic1.region_id, 
     ic1.page_id,
     ic1.region_name, 
     'IR' report_type,
     ic1.column_alias,
     ic1.report_label,
     coalesce(ic1.created_by, app.created_by) created_by, 
     coalesce(ic1.created_on, app.created_on) created_on, 
     coalesce(ic1.updated_by, app.last_updated_by) updated_by, 
     coalesce(ic1.updated_on, app.last_updated_on) updated_on,
     ic1.column_id component_id,
	   ic1.workspace
     from apex_application_page_ir_col ic1
     inner join apex_application_pages app on  app.page_id = ic1.page_id
                                           and app.application_id = ic1.application_id
     inner join v_svt_apex_applications aa on ic1.application_id = aa.application_id
                                       and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
	   where ic1.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
) a20
test.explanation: IR Report columns should escape HTML : Avoid turning the "Escape special characters" setting off on report columns
test.fix: To prevent Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks, always set this attribute to **On**. If you need to render HTML tags stored in the page item or in the entries of a list of values, you can set this flag to **Off**. In such cases, you should take additional precautions to ensure any user input to such fields are properly escaped when entered and before saving.

test.test_name: Buttons should be styled correctly
test.query_clob:
with std as (select case when aapb.button_name = 'DELETE'
                         then case when aapb.button_template_options not like '%danger%'
                                   then 'DANGER-DELETE'
                                   end
                         when aapb.button_name = 'CREATE'
                         then case when aapb.display_position_code = 'NEXT' and aa.theme_number = 1000
                                   then 'NEXT-CREATE'
                                   end
                         when aapb.icon_css_classes like 'fa-%'
                         then case when aa.theme_number = 1000
                                   then 'WRONGLIBRARY'
                                   when aapb.icon_css_classes like '%anim%'
                                   then 'BUTTON-ANIM'
                                   end
                         end child_code,
                    aapb.workspace, 
                    aapb.application_id, 
                    aapb.page_id, 
                    aapb.button_name, 
                    aapb.button_template_options,
                    aapb.button_id component_id,
                    aapb.last_updated_by, 
                    aapb.last_updated_on,
                    aa.theme_number,
                    aapb.display_position_code,
                    aapb.icon_css_classes
            from apex_application_page_buttons aapb
            inner join apex_applications aa on aapb.application_id = aa.application_id
						where aapb.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE'))
select case when std.child_code is not null 
            then 'N'
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.child_code is not null
            then apex_string.format(p_message => 'The `%0` button (app %1, page %2) %3.', 
                          p0 => std.button_name, 
                          p1 => std.application_id,
                          p2 => std.page_id,
                          p3 => case std.child_code 
                                     when 'DANGER-DELETE'
                                     then 'should be styled as "Danger". It currently has the following styling :`'||std.button_template_options||'`'
                                     when 'NEXT-CREATE'
                                     then 'should be placed in the `NEXT` position. It is currently in the following position: `'||std.display_position_code||'`'
                                     when 'BUTTON-ANIM'
                                     then 'has an animation. Please eliminate'
                                     when 'WRONGLIBRARY'
                                     then 'is using an invalid `Universal Theme` icon (`'||std.icon_css_classes||'`). You must use a `Redwood` icon'
                                     end) 
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.child_code is not null
            then apex_string.format(p_message => 'The `%0` button (app %1, page %2) is incorrectly styled', 
                          p0 => std.button_name, 
                          p1 => std.application_id,
                          p2 => std.page_id)  
            end issue_title,
	   std.child_code,
		 std.button_name, 
     std.button_template_options,
     std.component_id,
     std.display_position_code,
     null parent_component_id,
     std.theme_number,
     std.icon_css_classes,
		 std.workspace
from std
test.explanation:
Buttons should be styled and placed correctly according to their function :

*   BUTTON-ANIM : Including icons is fine (even encouraged). Icon placement should always be on the left. Adding animated icons (assigning a fa-anim-... class to an icon) is strongly discouraged. It's not the early 90's and this is not a geocities website.
*   DANGER-DELETE : Delete buttons should always styled as "Danger", and far away from the primary action.
*   NEXT-CREATE : Cancel button should be left-most button in the NEXT button position.
*   WRONGLIBRARY : You cannot use \`Universal Theme\` icons (the fa-fa icons) in \`Redwood\`.
test.fix:
*   BUTTON-ANIM : Remove the animation
*   DANGER-DELETE : Add the Danger style to the button
*   NEXT-CREATE : Reposition the button
*   WRONGLIBRARY : Use a Redwood icon

test.test_name: Filtered Regions has Card Container template
test.query_clob:
with filt_regns as (select workspace, application_id, page_id, filtered_region_id
                    from apex_application_page_regions
                    where source_type = 'Faceted Search')
select case when aapr.template = 'Cards Container'
            then 'Y'
            else 'N'
            end pass_yn,
       aapr.workspace,
       aapr.application_id, 
       aapr.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapr.last_updated_by,
       aapr.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Region `%0` (app %1, page %2) has the wrong template : `%3`', 
        p0 => aapr.region_name, 
        p1 => aapr.application_id,
        p2 => aapr.page_id,
        p3 => aapr.template) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Region `%0` (app %1, page %2) has the wrong template', 
        p0 => aapr.region_name, 
        p1 => aapr.application_id,
        p2 => aapr.page_id) issue_title,
       aapr.region_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapr.region_name,
       aapr.template,
       aapr.display_position,
       aapr.source_type,
       aapr.component_template_options,
       aapr.report_template
from apex_application_page_regions aapr
inner join filt_regns fr on  aapr.application_id = fr.application_id
                         and aapr.page_id = fr.page_id
                         and aapr.region_id = fr.filtered_region_id
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapr.page_id
                                      and aap.application_id = aapr.application_id
inner join apex_applications aa on aa.application_id = aapr.application_id
                                and aa.theme_number = 42
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on  aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on  aabo2.build_option_name = aapr.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapr.application_id
where aapr.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'

test.test_name: Button size should be default
test.query_clob:
with std as (select apb.application_id, 
                    apb.page_id, 
                    apb.button_id component_id, 
                    apb.button_name, 
                    bto.column_value template_option,
                    null created_by,
                    null created_on,
                    apb.last_updated_by,
                    apb.last_updated_on,
                    aap.build_option,
                    abo.build_option_status,
						 				abo.status_on_export,
						        apb.workspace
            from apex_application_page_buttons apb
            inner join table(apex_string.split(apb.button_template_options, ':')) bto 
                        on bto.column_value in ('rw-Button--sm', 'rw-Button--md', 'rw-Button--lg', 't-Button--tiny', 't-Button--small', 't-Button--large')
            inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.application_id = apb.application_id
                                                  and aap.page_id = apb.page_id
            left outer join apex_application_build_options abo on  abo.application_id = apb.application_id
                                                               and aap.build_option = abo.build_option_name
            where apb.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
						and coalesce(abo.status_on_export, 'NA') not in ('Exclude')
            )
select 'N'  pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Button `%0` (app %1, page %2) should have a default size but currently has a size of `%3`', 
                          p0 => std.button_name,
                          p1 => std.application_id,
                          p2 => std.page_id,
                          p3 => std.template_option) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Button `%0` (app %1, page %2) should have a default size', 
                          p0 => std.button_name,
                          p1 => std.application_id,
                          p2 => std.page_id) issue_title,
       std.component_id,
       std.button_name,
       std.template_option,
			 null parent_component_id,
			 std.workspace
from std
test.explanation: Button size should be default - always.
test.fix: Restore the button size to default

test.test_name: Reflow / Toggle Column header is appropriate
test.query_clob:
with std as (select case when regexp_instr (translate(prc.heading,'()-',' '), '[[:punct:]]') > 0
                then 'NOPUNCTUATION_RF'
								when upper(prc.heading) like '%YN'
                then 'YESNO_RF'
						    when prc.heading||' ' <> replace(prc.heading||' ','Id ', 'ID ')
                then 'CAPID_RF'
                end child_code,
       prc.application_id, 
       prc.page_id, 
       prc.name column_alias, 
       prc.heading report_label, 
       prc.region_name,
       prc.region_id,
       prc.region_column_id component_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       prc.last_updated_by,
       prc.last_updated_on,
       prc.is_visible,
			 prc.workspace
    from apex_application_page_reg_cols prc
    where prc.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
		and prc.is_visible = 'Yes'
)
select case when std.child_code is null 
            then 'Y' 
            else 'N'
            end pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('Column `%0` (region `%1`, page %2, app %3) %4',
                          p0 => std.report_label,
                          p1 => std.region_name,
                          p2 => std.page_id,
                          p3 => std.application_id,
                          p4 => case when std.child_code = 'NOPUNCTUATION_RF'
                                     then 'should not include punctuation'
																		 when std.child_code ='YESNO_RF'
																		 then 'should not include `YN`'
																		 when std.child_code ='CAPID_RF'
																		 then 'has incorrect capitalization for `ID`'
                                     end
                          ) 
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('Column `%0` is incorrectly formatted (region `%1`, page %2, app %3, col id %4) ',
                          p0 => std.report_label,
                          p1 => std.region_name,
                          p2 => std.page_id,
                          p3 => std.application_id,
													p4 => std.component_id
                          ) 
            end issue_title,
	   std.child_code,
     std.component_id,
     null parent_component_id,
		 std.workspace
from std
test.explanation:
Reflow and Column Toggle headers should be meaningful, formatted and punctuation free :

*   CAPID\_RF : Ensure the letters I and D are both capitalized in Column Headers like "Service ID, Resource ID, Region ID, etc..." These are incorrect: Service Id, service id, etc...
*   NOPUNCTUATION\_RF : Column Headers should not include punctuation
*   YESNO\_RF : Never include YN as part of the column header's title
test.fix:
*   CAPID\_RF : Correct the capitalization
*   NOPUNCTUATION\_RF : Remove the punctuation
*   YESNO\_RF : Rename column heading

test.test_name: Use Floating Labels
test.query_clob:
select 'N' pass_yn,
       api.application_id, 
       api.page_id, 
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       api.last_updated_by,
       api.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page Item `%0` (page %1, app %2) has a template of `%3` but should have a Floating Label. Use Floating Label templates for Modal Dialogs',
                          p0 => api.item_name,
                          p1 => api.page_id,
                          p2 => api.application_id,
                          p3 => api.item_label_template
                         ) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page Item `%0` (page %1, app %2) should have Floating Label template',
                          p0 => api.item_name,
                          p1 => api.page_id,
                          p2 => api.application_id
                         ) issue_title,
       api.item_name, 
       api.display_as,

from apex_application_page_items api 
inner join apex_applications aa on api.application_id = aa.application_id
                                and aa.theme_number = 42
inner join apex_application_pages aap on  api.application_id = aap.application_id

left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option

left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = api.build_option

where api.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')

and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and api.item_label_template not like '%Floating'
and api.display_as not in ('Hidden')
and api.item_label_template not in ('Hidden')
test.explanation: We want a consistent, modern look
test.fix: Use one of the 'Floating' templates (under Appearance)

test.test_name: Reports should have a reset button
test.query_clob:
with std as (select case when pir.show_search_bar = 'No'
                         then 'Y'
                         when apr.buttons = 0 
                         then 'N' 
                         else case when apb.display_position = 'RIGHT_OF_IR_SEARCH_BAR'
                                then 'Y'
                                else 'N'
                                end
                         end pass_yn,
                apr.application_id,
                apr.page_id,
                null created_by,
                null created_on,
                apr.last_updated_by,
                apr.last_updated_on,
                apr.region_name, 
                apr.buttons, 
                apb.button_name, 
                apb.label, 
                apb.display_position,
                apr.region_id component_id,
                apb.button_sequence,
                pir.show_search_bar,
						    apr.workspace
            from apex_application_page_regions apr
            inner join apex_application_pages aap on apr.application_id = aap.application_id
                                                  and apr.page_id = aap.page_id
            inner join apex_application_page_ir pir on apr.application_id = pir.application_id
                                                    and apr.page_id = pir.page_id
                                                    and apr.region_id = pir.region_id 
            left outer join apex_application_page_buttons apb on apr.application_id = apb.application_id
                                                              and apr.page_id = apb.page_id
                                                              and apr.region_id = apb.region_id
                                                              and apb.label = 'Reset'
            left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on  aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                                 and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
            left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on  aabo2.build_option_name = apr.build_option
                                                                 and aabo2.application_id = apr.application_id
            where apr.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
            and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
            and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
            )
select std.pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.pass_yn = 'N' 
            then apex_string.format('Report `%0` (page %1, app %2) is missing a Reset button in the correct location %3',
                                    p0 => std.region_name,
                                    p1 => std.page_id,
                                    p2 => std.application_id,
                                    p3 => case when std.display_position is not null
                                               then '( It is in the : `'||std.display_position||'` position but should be `Right of Interactive Report Search Bar` position in the left-most position)'
                                               end)
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.pass_yn = 'N' 
            then apex_string.format('Report `%0` (page %1, app %2) is missing a Reset button',
                                    p0 => std.region_name,
                                    p1 => std.page_id,
                                    p2 => std.application_id)
            end issue_title,
      show_search_bar,
      std.component_id,
      null parent_component_id,
      std.workspace
from std
test.explanation: Always display a reset button in the "Right of Interactive Report Toolbar" position. This reset button should be the left-most button in this position (any other buttons in this position should be to the left of the reset button).
test.fix: Create a reset button or correct the existing one by moving it's display position

test.test_name: Classic Column header is appropriate
test.query_clob:
with std as (
    select case when regexp_instr (translate(rpc.heading,'()-',' '), '[[:punct:]]') > 0
                then 'NOPUNCTUATION_C'
								when upper(rpc.heading) like '%YN'
                then 'YESNO_C'
	              when rpc.heading||' ' <> replace(rpc.heading||' ','Id ', 'ID ')
                then 'CAPID_C'
                end child_code,
       rpc.application_id, 
       rpc.page_id, 
       rpc.column_alias, 
       rpc.heading report_label, 
       rpc.region_name,
       rpc.region_id,
       rpc.region_report_column_id component_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       rpc.last_updated_by,
       rpc.last_updated_on,
       rpc.column_is_hidden,
	     rpc.workspace
    from apex_application_page_rpt_cols rpc
	  inner join apex_application_page_regions aar on rpc.application_id = aar.application_id
                                                 and rpc.page_id = aar.page_id
                                                 and rpc.region_id = aar.region_id
    left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aar.build_option
                                                         and aabo1.application_id = aar.application_id
    where rpc.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
	  and rpc.column_is_hidden = 'No'
	  and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
)
select case when std.child_code is null 
            then 'Y' 
            else 'N'
            end pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('Column `%0` (Classic Report `%1`, page %2, app %3) %4',
                          p0 => std.report_label,
                          p1 => std.region_name,
                          p2 => std.page_id,
                          p3 => std.application_id,
                          p4 => case when std.child_code = 'NOPUNCTUATION_C'
                                     then 'should not include punctuation'
																		 when std.child_code ='YESNO_C'
																		 then 'should not include `YN`'
																		 when std.child_code ='CAPID_C'
																		 then 'has incorrect capitalization for `ID`'
                                     end
                          ) 
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.child_code is not null 
            then apex_string.format('Column `%0` is incorrectly formatted (region `%1`, page %2, app %3, column id %4)',
                          p0 => std.report_label,
                          p1 => std.region_name,
                          p2 => std.page_id,
                          p3 => std.application_id,
												  p4 => std.component_id
                          ) 
            end issue_title,
	   std.child_code,
     std.component_id,
     null parent_component_id,
		 std.workspace
from std
test.explanation:
Classic Report Column headers should be meaningful, formatted and punctuation free :

*   CAPID\_C : Ensure the letters I and D are both capitalized in Column Headers like "Service ID, Resource ID, Region ID, etc..." These are incorrect: Service Id, service id, etc...
*   NOPUNCTUATION\_C : Column Headers should not include punctuation
*   YESNO\_C : Never include YN as part of the column header's title
test.fix:
*   CAPID\_C : Correct the capitalization
*   NOPUNCTUATION\_C : Remove the punctuation
*   YESNO\_C : Rename column heading

test.test_name: Health apps should have Sky Pillar set

select case

        end pass_yn, 
        aats.name theme_name, 
        jt.firstclass,
       aa.workspace,
       aa.application_id, 
       null page_id,
       aa.created_by,
       aa.created_on,
       aa.last_updated_by,
       aa.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Application `%0` (app %1) Theme Roller has the wrong selection under Redwood Options > Pillar: `%2`',

       apex_string.format('Application `%0` (app %1) Theme Roller has the wrong selection under Redwood Options > Pillar: `%2`',

test.explanation: For all Oracle Health applications, Sky is the official Redwood Pillar to be used, as confirmed by the Redwood Team.
test.fix:
If you have a Redwood Themed application, you must select Sky as the Pillar option under Theme Roller.

*   If you do not see this option under _**Theme Roller > Redwood Options > Pillar**_, your application may have an outdated version of the Redwood Theme in APEX. Proceed to updating to the latest version by subscribing to Application 9000.

test.test_name: Contextual Info regions should be configured correctly
test.query_clob:
select case when aapr.template not in ('No Template', 'Blank with Attributes')
            then 'N'
            when aapr.display_position != 'Contextual Info'
            then 'N'
            when aapr.report_template != 'Contextual Info (Row)'
            then 'N'
            when aap.page_template in ('AO Foldout (Horizontal Header)','Foldout (Horizontal Header)')
            then case when aapr.component_template_options not like '%js-ConveyorBelt%'
                      then 'N'
                      when aapr.component_template_options not like '%rw-ContextualInfo--horizontal%'
                      then 'N'
                      when aapr.component_template_options not like '%rw-ContextualInfo--labelInline%'
                      then 'N'
                      when aapr.component_template_options not like '%rw-Report--hideNoPagination%'
                      then 'N'
                      else 'Y'
                      end
            when aap.page_template in ('AO Foldout (Vertical Header)','Foldout (Vertical Header)','Item Overview','AO Item Overview','Item Overview')
            then case when aapr.component_template_options not like '%rw-ContextualInfo--vertical%'
                      then 'N'
                      when aapr.component_template_options not like '%rw-ContextualInfo--labelStacked%'
                      then 'N'
                      when aapr.component_template_options not like '%rw-Report--hideNoPagination%'
                      then 'N'
                      else 'Y'
                      end
            when aap.page_template in ('AO General Overview','General Overview','Generic')
            then case when aapr.component_template_options not like '%rw-Report--hideNoPagination%'
                      then 'N'
                      else 'Y'
                      end
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,                          
       aapr.application_id, 
       aapr.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aapr.last_updated_by,
       aapr.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Region `%0` (app %1, page %2) is misconfigured (template `%3`, display position `%4`, template options `%5`, report template `%6`, page template `%7`', 
        p0 => aapr.region_name, 
        p1 => aapr.application_id,
        p2 => aapr.page_id,
        p3 => aapr.template,
        p4 => aapr.display_position,
        p5 => aapr.component_template_options,
        p6 => aapr.report_template,
        p7 => aap.page_template) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Region `%0` (app %1, page %2) is misconfigured', 
        p0 => aapr.region_name, 
        p1 => aapr.application_id,
        p2 => aapr.page_id) issue_title,
       aapr.region_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aapr.region_name,
       aapr.template,
       aapr.display_position,
       aapr.source_type,
       aapr.component_template_options,
       aapr.report_template,
       aa.theme_number,
       aap.page_template,
			 aapr.workspace
from apex_application_page_regions aapr
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapr.page_id and aap.application_id = aapr.application_id
inner join apex_applications aa on aa.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapr.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapr.application_id
where aapr.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and aa.theme_number = 1000
and aapr.region_name = 'Contextual Info'
and aapr.source_type = 'Report'
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation:
The Contextual Info Classic Report should be:

1.  inside the `Contextual info` display position
2.  with a template of `none` or `Blank with Attributes`
3.  with a report template of `Contextual Info (Row)`

### Page template considerations

### `Foldout (Horizontal Header)`

1.  Check `Conveyor Belt`
2.  Set Layout to `Horizontal`
3.  Set Label to `Inline`
4.  Set Pagination Display to `Hide when all rows displayed`

### `Foldout (Vertical Header)` / `Item Overview`

1.  Set Layout to `Vertical`
2.  Set Label to `Stacked`
3.  Set Pagination Display to `Hide when all rows displayed`

### `General Overview` / `Generic`

1.  Set Pagination Display to `Hide when all rows displayed`
test.fix: Correct the display position, template, report template or template options

       aap.created_by,
       aap.created_on,
       aap.last_updated_by,
       aap.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format(
        p_message => q'^Page %0 (Application %1) has page-level inline CSS^',
        p0 => aap.page_id,
        p1 => aap.application_id) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format(
        p_message => q'^Remove page-level inline CSS (Page %0 /Application %1) ^',
        p0 => aap.page_id,
        p1 => aap.application_id) issue_title,
			 aap.build_option,
       abo.build_option_status,
       abo.status_on_export,
			 aap.page_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
			 aap.workspace
from apex_application_pages aap
inner join v_svt_apex_applications aa on aap.application_id = aa.application_id
                                  and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
left outer join apex_application_build_options abo on abo.application_id = aap.application_id 
                                                   and abo.build_option_name = aap.build_option
where aap.workspace = svt_preferences.get('SVT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(abo.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
test.explanation: All CSS should be centralized and kept out of local pages. Applications should consolidate CSS and not have CSS locally
test.fix: Remove page level CSS

test.test_name: DML Triggers must have schema prefix for table

select case when description like '%.%'
         then 'Y'

       ut.description,

       apex_string.format('Trigger `%0` needs to prefix `%2` with the schema `%3` : `%1`',

							p1 => ut.description,
							p2 => ut.table_name,

test.test_name: Missing Comments
test.query_clob:
with proc_declrtns as (
    select line, name, object_name, signature, object_type, owner
    from v_user_identifiers
    where type  in ('PROCEDURE','FUNCTION')
    -- and object_type = 'PACKAGE'
    and usage  = 'DECLARATION'
    and object_name not like '%_UT' --this requirement does not apply to utplsql packages
    and object_name not like 'XXX%')
select 
case when trim(us.text) like '--%'
     then 'Y'
     else 'N'
     end as pass_yn,
apex_string.format('%1 (line %2, %3) appears to be missing a comment', pd.object_name, pd.name, pd.line, us.type) code,
pd.object_name,
us.type object_type,
pd.line,
us.text,
to_char(pd.signature) unqid,
us.owner schema
from v_user_source us 
inner join proc_declrtns pd on  us.type = pd.object_type
                            and us.name = pd.object_name
                            and us.line = (pd.line - 1)
test.explanation: This procedure appears to be missing a comment or the comment is incorrectly formatted. All package procedures and functions require an explanatory comment

select  'N' pass_yn,
        object_name,
        object_type,
        0 line,
        apex_string.format('%0 is invalid', object_name) code,
         'INVALID OBJECT : '||owner||'.'||object_name unqid,
				 owner schema

test.test_name: Foreign keys must be indexed
test.query_clob:
with tblfk as (select 
cons.table_name, 
cons.owner,
cons.constraint_name,
cons.cname1 || nvl2(cons.cname2,','||cons.cname2,null) ||
nvl2(cons.cname3,','||cons.cname3,null) || nvl2(cons.cname4,','||cons.cname4,null) ||
nvl2(cons.cname5,','||cons.cname5,null) || nvl2(cons.cname6,','||cons.cname6,null) ||
nvl2(cons.cname7,','||cons.cname7,null) || nvl2(cons.cname8,','||cons.cname8,null) icolumns
from ( select   b.owner,
			          b.table_name,
                b.constraint_name,
                max(decode( position, 1, column_name, null )) cname1,
                max(decode( position, 2, column_name, null )) cname2,
                max(decode( position, 3, column_name, null )) cname3,
                max(decode( position, 4, column_name, null )) cname4,
                max(decode( position, 5, column_name, null )) cname5,
                max(decode( position, 6, column_name, null )) cname6,
                max(decode( position, 7, column_name, null )) cname7,
                max(decode( position, 8, column_name, null )) cname8,
                count(*) col_cnt
            from (select substr(table_name,1,30) table_name,
                        substr(constraint_name,1,30) constraint_name,
                        substr(column_name,1,30) column_name,
                        position
                    from v_user_cons_columns ) a,
                v_user_constraints b
        where a.constraint_name = b.constraint_name
            and b.constraint_type = 'R'
        group by b.owner,b.table_name, b.constraint_name
        ) cons
where cons.col_cnt > ALL
        ( select count(*)
            from v_user_ind_columns i
            where i.table_name = cons.table_name
            and i.column_name in (cname1, cname2, cname3, cname4,
                                    cname5, cname6, cname7, cname8 )
            and i.column_position <= cons.col_cnt
            group by i.index_name
        )
)
select 
'N' pass_yn,
'MISSING_FK :'||table_name unqid,
table_name, constraint_name, icolumns,
apex_string.format('Constraint %0 on column(s) %1 is missing an index', constraint_name, icolumns) code,
ao.object_id,
tblfk.owner schema
from tblfk
inner join all_objects ao on ao.object_name = tblfk.table_name
                          and ao.object_type = 'TABLE'
test.explanation: Foreign keys must be indexed
test.fix: Eg `create index eba_stdapp_idx1 on eba_stds_applications (type_id)`

test.test_name: Urgent PLSQL Warning
test.query_clob:
select
'N' pass_yn,
ae.name object_name, 
ae.type object_type,
ae.line, 
apex_string.format('%0[%1.%2]',ae.text,ae.owner,ae.name) code,
apex_string.format('%0:%1:%2:%3', ae.name, ae.line, ae.message_number, ae.sequence) unqid,
ae.message_number, 
ae.sequence,
ae.position,
ae.attribute,
ae.owner schema
from v_user_errors ae
where ae.name not like 'XXX%'
and ae.message_number > 1919 -- will not compile
and (ae.message_number between 5000 and 5999 --severe according the to documentation
     or -- informational according to the documentation, but severe according to me
     ae.message_number in (6002, -- unreachable code
                           6009, -- procedure "string" OTHERS handler does not end in RAISE
                           6017 -- operation will raise an exception
                           )
    )
and ae.message_number not in (5018)
test.explanation: This script has some important violations caught by enabling PLSQL\_WARNINGS
test.fix: Address the PLSQL warning and recompile

test.test_name: Naming Convention violation
test.query_clob:
with var_assgn as (select signature, max(line) last_line
                    from v_user_identifiers ui
                    where ui.type = 'VARIABLE'
                    and ui.usage = 'ASSIGNMENT'
                    group by signature),
     cur_ref_count
            as (select signature, count(*) refcount
                  from v_user_identifiers
                  where usage = 'REFERENCE'
                  and type = 'CONSTANT'
                  group by signature),
     ccode 
            as (select
                case when ui.type = 'CONSTANT' 
                        then case when ui.object_type = 'PACKAGE'
                                  then case when (ui.name not like 'GC_%') 
                                            then 'SPEC_CONSTANT'
                                            end
                                  when ui.object_type = 'PACKAGE BODY' 
                                    then case when ui.usage_context_id  = 1
                                              then case when ui.name not like 'GC_%'
                                                        then 'GLOBAL_CONSTANT'
                                                        else case when crc.refcount < 2
                                                                  then case when ui.name not in ('GC_SCOPE_PREFIX', 'GC_N', 'GC_Y')
                                                                            then 'LOCAL_GLOBAL_CONSTANT'
                                                                            end
                                                                  end 
                                                        end
                                              else case when  (ui.name not like 'C_%')
                                                        then 'LOCAL_CONSTANT'
                                                        end
                                              end
                                 end
                     when ui.type = 'VARIABLE'
                     then case when ui.object_type = 'PACKAGE'
                               then 'SPEC_VARIABLE'
                               when ui.object_type = 'PACKAGE BODY'
                               then case when ui.line = va.last_line
                                         then 'CONSTANT_VARIABLE'
                                         end
                               end
                     when ui.type in ('CURSOR','REFCURSOR') 
                     then case when ui.name not like 'CUR_%'
                               then 'CURSOR'
                               end 
                     when ui.type in ('INDEX TABLE', 'NESTED TABLE', 'ASSOCIATIVE ARRAY') 
                     then case when ui.name not like 'T_%'
                               then 'TABLE_TYPE'
                               end
                     when ui.type in ('FORMAL IN','FORMAL OUT', 'FORMAL IN OUT') 
                     then case when ui.name not like 'P_%'
                               then 'PROC_PARAM'
                               end
                     when ui.type = 'RECORD'
                     then case when ui.name not like 'R_%'
                               then 'RECORD_TYPE'
                               end 
                     when ui.type in ('BLOB DATATYPE','BOOLEAN DATATYPE','CHARACTER DATATYPE','CLOB DATATYPE','DATE DATATYPE','NUMBER DATATYPE', 'SUBTYPE','TIMESTAMP DATATYPE')
                     then case when ui.name not like 'TY_%'
                               then 'DATATYPE'
                               end
                     when ui.type = 'EXCEPTION'
                     then case when ui.name not like 'E_%'
                               then 'EXCEPTION'
                               end
                     end as child_code,
                null src_id, 
                ui.object_name, 
                ui.name code, 
                ui.object_type, 
                ui.line,
                to_char(ui.signature) unqid,
								ui.owner
                from v_user_identifiers ui
                left join var_assgn va on ui.signature = va.signature
                left join cur_ref_count crc on ui.signature = crc.signature
                where ui.usage = 'DECLARATION'
                and ui.implicit = 'NO'
                and ui.object_name not like 'XXX%'
                and ui.name not in ('GC_SCOPE_PREFIX', 'GC_N', 'GC_Y'))
select 
case when child_code is null
    then 'Y'
    else 'N'
    end pass_yn,
object_name,
apex_string.format('%0 %1 in `%2` %3, line %4',
                    p0 => code,
                    p1 => case child_code 
                          when 'CONSTANT_VARIABLE'
                          then 'must be a constant (it is currently a variable)'
                          when 'CURSOR'
                          then 'must begin with cur_ (it is a cursor)'
                          when 'DATATYPE'
                          then 'must begin with ty_ (it is a datatype)'
                          when 'EXCEPTION'
                          then 'must begin with e_ (it is an Exception)'
                          when 'GLOBAL_CONSTANT'
                          then 'must begin with gc_ (it is a package body global constant)'
                          when 'LOCAL_CONSTANT'
                          then 'must begin with c_ (it is a package body local constant) '
                          when 'LOCAL_GLOBAL_CONSTANT'
                          then 'should be a local constant (it is currently a global constant)'
                          when 'PROC_PARAM'
                          then 'must begin with p_ (it is a procedure parameter)'
                          when 'RECORD_TYPE'
                          then 'must begin with r_ (it is a Record type)'
                          when 'SPEC_CONSTANT'
                          then 'must begin with gc_ (it is a package spec constant)'
                          when 'SPEC_VARIABLE'
                          then 'should be moved to the package body'
                          when 'TABLE_TYPE'
                          then 'must being with t_ (it is a Table type)'
                          end,
									 p2 => object_name,
									 p3 => object_type,
									 p4 => line
) code,
object_type,
line,
unqid,
owner schema
from ccode
where child_code is not null
test.explanation:
*   CONSTANT\_VARIABLE : This variable should be a constant
*   CURSOR : Cursor names must begin with cur\_
*   DATATYPE : Datatypes must begin with ty\_
*   EXCEPTION : Exceptions must begin with e\_
*   GLOBAL\_CONSTANT : Package body global constants must begin with gc\_
*   LOCAL\_CONSTANT : Package body local constants must begin with c\_
*   LOCAL\_GLOBAL\_CONSTANT : This global constant should be a local constant
*   PROC\_PARAM : Procedure parameters must begin with p\_
*   RECORD\_TYPE : Record types must begin with r\_
*   SPEC\_CONSTANT : Package spec constants must begin with gc\_
*   SPEC\_VARIABLE : Variables in the package spec are discouraged
*   TABLE\_TYPE : Table types must begin with t\_
test.fix:
*   CONSTANT\_VARIABLE : Make the variable a constant
*   CURSOR : Fix the name
*   DATATYPE : Fix the name
*   EXCEPTION : Fix the name
*   GLOBAL\_CONSTANT : Fix the name
*   LOCAL\_CONSTANT : Fix the name
*   LOCAL\_GLOBAL\_CONSTANT : Make it a local constant
*   PROC\_PARAM : Fix the name
*   RECORD\_TYPE : Fix the name
*   SPEC\_CONSTANT : Fix the name
*   SPEC\_VARIABLE : Remove the variable from the package spec
*   TABLE\_TYPE : Fix the name

test.test_name: Unused identifers
test.query_clob:
with  declared_ids  
            as (select object_name  
                  , object_type  
                  , name
                  , type
                  , signature
                  , line
								  , owner
                  from v_user_identifiers
                  where usage = 'DECLARATION'
                  and type in ('VARIABLE', 'EXCEPTION','CONSTANT')
                  and implicit = 'NO'
                  and object_name not like 'XXX%'
                  and name not in ('C_LIMIT','GC_Y','GC_N')
                  ),  
      used_ids
            as (select signature, line
                  from v_user_identifiers
                  where usage in ('REFERENCE','ASSIGNMENT')
               ),
      intersct as (
            select di.signature, count(*) it_count
            from declared_ids di 
            inner join used_ids ui on di.signature = ui.signature
                                   and di.line    != ui.line
            group by di.signature
      )
select 
case when it.signature is null
     then 'N'
		 else 'Y'
     end as pass_yn,
di.object_name, 
di.object_type, 
apex_string.format('Unused variable %0 should be dropped (in %1)',di.name, di.object_name) code, 
di.type,
di.line,
to_char(di.signature) unqid,
di.owner schema
from declared_ids di
left join intersct it on  di.signature = it.signature
test.explanation: This identifier has been declared but is not referenced anywhere.
test.fix: Remove the identifier or use it

test.test_name: Duplicate Statements
test.query_clob:
select
'N' pass_yn,
us.object_name, 
us.object_type,
us.line, 
apex_string.format('Consolidate instances of `%0` in `%1` %2', 
									 p0 => substr(trim(us.text),1,30),
									 p1 => us.object_name,
									 p2 => us.object_type) code,
to_char(rank() over (partition by us.object_type, us.object_name, sc.sql_id order by us.line)|| sc.sql_id) as unqid,
us.owner schema
from v_user_statements us
inner join (select sql_id
            from v_user_statements
            where sql_id is not null 
            and object_name not like '%_UT' --this requirement does not apply to utplsql packages
						and text not like '%COLUMN_VALUE%'
            having count(*) > 1
            group by sql_id ) sc on sc.sql_id = us.sql_id
where us.object_name not like '%_UT' --this requirement does not apply to utplsql packages
and us.object_name not like 'XXX%'
test.explanation: This statement appears more than once. Duplicate statements may cause inefficiency
test.fix: Consider consolidating the statements into a single function or procedure

test.test_name: Missing DBMS_ASSERT
test.query_clob:
with userprocs as (select owner, object_name, object_type, type, name proc_name, line start_line, LEAD(line, 1, 10000) OVER (partition by object_name ORDER BY line) end_line
                    from v_user_identifiers
                    where object_type = 'PACKAGE BODY'
                    and usage_context_id = 1
                    and type in ('FUNCTION', 'PROCEDURE')
                    and object_name not like 'XXX%'
                    ),
     exec_imm as (select object_name, line ei_line, signature
                    from v_user_statements
                    where type = 'EXECUTE IMMEDIATE'
                    and object_type = 'PACKAGE BODY'
                 ),
     dass as (select name object_name, line da_line, text
                from v_user_source
                where lower(text) like '%dbms_assert%'
                and type = 'PACKAGE BODY')
select 
'N' pass_yn,
u.object_name, 
u.object_type, 
apex_string.format('%1.%0 should use dbms_assert to safely use `execute immediate`',u.proc_name, u.object_name) code, 
ei.ei_line line, 
to_char(ei.signature) unqid,
u.owner schema
from userprocs u
inner join exec_imm ei on ei.object_name = u.object_name
                       and ei.ei_line between u.start_line and u.end_line
left join dass da on da.object_name = u.object_name
                  and da.da_line between u.start_line and u.end_line
where da.da_line is null
test.explanation: "Execute Immediate" should be validated with DBMS\_ASSERT : Input must be sanitized
test.fix: Use dbms\_assert. If all else fails, you can always use `DBMS_ASSERT.NOOP`

test.test_name: Fix Invalid View
test.query_clob:
select 'N' pass_yn, 
       ao.object_name view_name, 
       apex_string.format('View `%0` is invalid',
              p0 => ao.object_name) code,
       ao.object_id unqid,
			 ao.owner schema
from v_user_objects ao
where ao.status != 'VALID'
and ao.object_type = 'VIEW'
test.explanation: Views must be valid
test.fix: Fix the view and recompile

test.test_name: Discouraged code
test.query_clob:
with qry as (select
               case when lower(us.text) like '%nvl%'
                    then 'NVL'
                    when lower(us.text) like '%decode%'
                    then 'CASE'
                    when lower(us.text) like '% goto %'
                    then 'GOTO'
                    when lower(us.text) like '%apex_util.prepare_url%'
                    then 'GET_URL'
						        when us.text like '%(+)%'
                    then 'ANSI'
                    end as child_code,
               us.type object_type,
               us.name object_name, 
               us.text code, 
               us.line ,
						   us.owner,
               to_char(rank() over (partition by us.type, us.name, apex_string_util.get_slug(substr(us.text,1,255)) order by us.line)) as unqid
               from v_user_source us
               where us.name not like 'BIN$%'
               and us.name not like 'XXX%'
               and us.type in ('PACKAGE BODY','PACKAGE', 'PROCEDURE', 'FUNCTION')
               ),
     us as (
          select 'COMMIT' child_code,
                 u.object_type, 

                 u.object_name, 
                 'commit' code,
                 u.line,
                 u.signature unqid,
			  				 u.owner
          from v_user_statements u
          where u.type = 'COMMIT'
     ), 
     tst as (select 
                 q.child_code,
                 q.object_type, 
                 q.object_name, 
                 q.line, 
                 q.code, 
                 q.unqid,
						     q.owner
            from qry q
            where q.child_code is not null
            union all 
            select 
                 u.child_code,
                 u.object_type, 
                 u.object_name, 
                 u.line, 
                 u.code,
                 u.unqid,
						     u.owner
            from us u)
select 'N' pass_yn, 
      object_type, 
      object_name, 
      line, 
      apex_string.format('%0 (`%1` in `%2` line %3)',
                        p0 => case child_code
                              when 'ANSI' then 'ANSI SQL is discouraged'
                              when 'NVL' then 'Use `coalesce` instead of `nvl`'
                              when 'CASE' then 'Use `case` instead of `decode`'
                              when 'GOTO' then '`GOTO` is discouraged'
                              when 'COMMIT' then '`commits` are discouraged'
												      when 'GET_URL' then 'use `apex_page.get_url` instead of `prepare_url`'
                              end,
                        p1 => substr(trim(code),1,25),
												p2 => object_name,
												p3 => line
                    ) code, 
      unqid,
			owner schema
from tst
test.explanation: Coding practices that are discouraged
test.fix:
*   ANSI : Use ANSI SQL Syntax
*   CASE : Replace with CASE statement
*   COMMIT : Remove commit or at least add an explanatory comment
*   GOTO : Remove GOTO or at least add an explanatory comment
*   NVL : Replace nvl with coalesce
*   GET\_URL : user apex\_page.get\_url instead of apex\_util.prepare\_url

test.test_name: This schema should not have triggers
test.query_clob:
select 'N' pass_yn, 
       ut.trigger_name, 
       apex_string.format('Trigger `%0` should be dropped',
              p0 => ut.trigger_name) code,
			 ut.owner schema,
       ut.object_id unqid --row-level unique id 
from v_user_triggers ut
where ut.owner in ('AST','SVT')
test.explanation: This schema uses APIs instead of triggers

test.test_name: Use TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE where appropriate
test.query_clob:
with dt_ts as (select table_name, column_name, data_type, 
                case when data_type ='DATE'
                     then 'N'
                     when data_type like '%LOCAL%'
                     then 'N'
                     when data_type not like '%ZONE%'
                     then 'N'
                     else 'Y'
                     end pass_yn
            from v_user_tab_cols atc
            where (data_type like '%TIMES%' or data_type  = 'DATE')
        ),
    lstag as (select table_name, listagg(column_name, ', ' on overflow truncate) within group (order by column_name) col_list
                from dt_ts
                where pass_yn = 'N'
                group by table_name)
select 'N' pass_yn,
       ao.object_name table_name, 
       ao.object_id unqid,
       apex_string.format('The following columns in table `%0` should be changed to Timestamp with Local Time Zone : `%1`', 
        p0 => ao.object_name,
        p1 => lstag.col_list) code,
       ao.object_id,
			 ao.owner schema
from v_user_objects ao
inner join lstag on ao.object_name = lstag.table_name
where ao.object_type = 'TABLE'
and ao.object_name not in (select mview_name
                           from v_user_mviews)
test.explanation: In most cases using TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE is the safest option, rather than using DATE or TIMESTAMP WITH LOCAL TIME ZONE ([Database Design Standards documentation](https://confluence.oraclecorp.com/confluence/display/ALPHA/Database+Design+Standards))
test.fix: Change the column type : `alter table t modify col1 timestamp with time zone;`

test.test_name: Use Char not Bytes
test.query_clob:
with oc as (select  utc.table_name, listagg( utc.column_name, ', ' on overflow truncate) within group (order by utc.column_name) col_list
            from v_user_tab_cols utc
            where  utc.char_used = 'B'
            group by utc.table_name)
select 'N' pass_yn,
       ao.object_name table_name, 
       ao.object_id unqid,
       apex_string.format('The following columns in table `%0` are the wrong character set: `%1`', 
        p0 => ao.object_name,
        p1 => oc.col_list) code,
       ao.object_id,
       oc.col_list,
			 ao.owner schema
from v_user_objects ao
inner join oc on ao.object_name = oc.table_name
where ao.object_type = 'TABLE'
and ao.object_name not in (select mview_name
                           from v_user_mviews)
test.explanation: You want to specify CHAR storage because it is more practical than BYTE storage (a single character can require several bytes)
test.fix: Alter the character set :`alter table t modify col_1 varchar2(xxx char);`

test.test_name: These column datatypes are discouraged
test.query_clob:
with thecols as (select table_name, listagg(column_name, ', ' on overflow truncate) within group (order by column_name) col_list
                    from v_user_tab_cols
                    where data_type in ('LONG','CHAR','VARCHAR')
								    and table_name not like '%MV%'
                    group by table_name)
select 'N' pass_yn,
       ao.object_name table_name, 
       ao.object_id unqid,
       apex_string.format('The following columns in table `%0` are using Long, varchar or char : `%1`', 
        p0 => ao.object_name,
        p1 => substr(thecols.col_list,1,50)) code, 
       ao.object_id,
       ao.owner schema
from v_user_objects ao
inner join thecols on thecols.table_name = ao.object_name
where ao.object_type = 'TABLE'
test.explanation: Column datatypes of Long, varchar or char are discouraged ([database design standards documentation](https://confluence.oraclecorp.com/confluence/display/ALPHA/Database+Design+Standards))
test.fix: Clob or varchar2 are probably good substitutes for these datatypes

test.test_name: Materialized Views should be named correctly
test.query_clob:
select 'N' pass_yn, 
       ao.object_name mv_name, 
       apex_string.format('Materialized View `%0` should be suffixed with `_MV`',
                          p0 => ao.object_name) code,
       ao.object_id unqid,
			 ao.owner schema
from v_user_objects ao
where ao.object_type = 'MATERIALIZED VIEW'
and ao.object_name not like '%_MV'
test.explanation: Materialized Views should be suffixed with \`\_MV\`
test.fix: Correct the MV name

test.test_name: Alphawave Views must be correctly named
test.query_clob:
select 'N' pass_yn, 
       ao.object_name view_name, 
       apex_string.format('View `%0` should be suffixed with `_V`',
              p0 => ao.object_name) code,
       ao.object_id unqid,
			 ao.owner schema
from v_user_objects ao
where ao.object_name not like '%_V'
and ao.object_type = 'VIEW'
and ao.owner not in ('SVT','AST')
test.explanation: Views should have an "\_v" suffix to the view name.
test.fix: Fix the view name

test.test_name: Tables should have audit columns
test.query_clob:
select case when utc.col_count is null
            then 'N' 
            when utc.col_count < 4
            then 'N' 
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,
       ao.object_name table_name,
       ao.object_id unqid,
       apex_string.format('Table `%0` is missing audit columns (`CREATED,CREATED_BY,UPDATED,UPDATED_BY`)', 
        p0 => ao.object_name) code,
       ao.object_id,
       coalesce(utc.col_count,0) col_count,
			 ao.owner schema
from v_user_objects ao
left outer join (select table_name, count(*) col_count
                 from v_user_tab_cols
                 where column_name in ('CREATED','CREATED_BY','UPDATED','UPDATED_BY')
                 group by table_name
                 ) utc on utc.table_name = ao.object_name
where ao.object_type = 'TABLE'
and ao.object_name not in (select mview_name
                           from v_user_mviews)
test.explanation:
The following standard columns must be defined on application tables (exceptions to be agreed), and represent what we would typically refer to as "audit" columns. These should be maintained by a trigger.

*   CREATED\_BY VARCHAR2(255 CHAR)
*   CREATED\_ON DATE
*   UPDATED\_BY VARCHAR2(255 CHAR)
*   UPDATED\_ONDATE
test.fix: Add the requisite audit columns
